author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1672875368}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right handâ€”the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bedâ€”the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998985381', 'num_games_owned': 1678, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1699672702}
review:
This game is poorly designed and poorly implemented.

- The level design is bad.
- The level graphics are bad. Sometimes impossible to know what is background and what is foreground.
- The enemy placement is bad.
- The enemy collision is bad.
  â†’ If you jump on top of two enemies, you get hit. You can only jump on one enemy per time.
  â†’ If you get hit, you get temporary invincibility for a few seconds. You can't attack enemies during this time.
- All enemies respawn shortly after being killed. After a while, you figure out it's easier to ignore enemies and tank any hits.
- The end-of-level score and 3-star rating isn't very clear, and quite frustrating.
- All the secondary collectibles disappear after you complete the primary objective, which means you can't collect them for higher score.
- Have I mentioned the level design is bad? You have a time limit, but you are also very limited in your movement options. (Often having to wait for moving platforms or having to take a very long route.)
- The sequence of moving platforms are not synchronized. You have to wait for a few cycles until the platforms align favorably. And then you get knocked off by a flying enemy.

Well, at least the game is quite stable: I didn't notice any crashes nor game-breaking glitches.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021864291', 'num_games_owned': 1727, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1673130309}
review:
Ja, also, ehm.
Canyon Capers ist ein 2D Platformer, der nicht ganz so deep ist. Zwar unterscheidet sich das Ziel pro Level (etwa "Sammel alle Kisten ein" oder "Sammel alle Edelsteine ein"), jedoch ist das Erlebnis sehr trist. Die Level sind nicht sehr umfangreich, das Gameplay macht so viel SpaÃŸ wie ein Zahnarztbesuch und die Gegner sind halt da. Ich hatte leider sehr wenig SpaÃŸ (die restlichen 4 Spielstunden kamen durch Sammelkartenfarming zustande) und war dann doch sehr froh als es vorbei war. 

Definitiv nicht empfehlenswert. Vorallem, weil es als Vollpreis einfach mal 6â‚¬ kostet. Da hol ich mir doch lieber einen DÃ¶ner bei Haus des DÃ¶ners (muss zwar dann nochmal 50 Cent drauflegen, aber dafÃ¼r weiÃŸ ich, dass ich dann was richtig Gutes bekomme). MÃ¼sst ihr wissen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068174012', 'num_games_owned': 690, 'num_reviews': 385, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1648409251}
review:
Canyon Capers (2014)

A very... interesting game to say the least. You control this guy who collect stuff to progress towards the next level. Later in the game you can use other characters all with a unique ability. The gameplay is very stiff, it feels like a 2001 flash game you play on those shady websites back in school where the anti-virus is going nuts but you just ignore that. I'm probably not going to ever complete this game, I feel its... ok for what it is. Just don't expect too much with this one, but you might kill off a few hours with it if you literally have nothing els to play.

5/10

review:
Nothing in this sorry excuse for a "game" is anything worth valued for you to play it for more than 1 hour without get a fucking stroke. Every asset in this game is so clearly ripped from other games and they don't even ATTEMPT to hide any of it. Its a prime example of why people should stop being apologetic for shit one dollar budget games. I don't care if its a passion project or someone's "dream". Its a stinky, smelly piece of worthless shit. 

0/10

To the person who manufactured this fucking trash game, never make another one for the other peoples sanity.

..Not to mention it's a "tribute', to some old ass game from the 90's named Dino Jr. which later turned into a huckleberry hound game.
Use that information as you please..

author: {'steamid': '76561198063828954', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 645, 'last_played': 1622246673}
review:
If you are still buying this in the year 2021 you've got some problems. Not recommended, completely outdated game. You will hate yourself when attempting to go for the achievements, just like I hate myself right now after getting this in like 2015 and grabbing some achievements while waiting for the trading cards to pop up.

Just some examples because I feel like writing a negative review without really stating why would be rude.
- The level design isnt great. Its trying to be open and give you a choice what to collect first, but in the end the Vortex (place to leave the level) will spawn in a spot that makes it seems like there was "the optimal path" which will make you lose time and points and with that stars, which theres 3 to get from every level. (mobile games from 2012 much, huh?).
- The difficulty spiked up quite fast and isnt in your common range of gameplay balancing. Most of the levels are doable but often they will just feel unfair at parts and later on they will be stacked with traps and unenjoyable platforming. I studied gamedesign, this game doesnt do much of it right.
- The graphics didnt age well and the characters look ugly (they remind me of Bolbi Stroganovsky from Jimmy Neutron. slap slap slap, clap clap clap.)
- The mission objectives are in an ever repeating cycle. Not interesting.
- The controls. You will start hating the game first, then you will continue hating the game and yourself for the actions that you will do, that will bring failure to you. And theres only [Left Arrow] [Right Arrow] and [Spacebar], yet the controls feel so so bad and you dont really see yourself improving with them.

+ Theres one thing thats done well in the game and thats the different abilities of the characters, sometimes you wanna switch to a different one for a specific level to get through better. Thats cool and all but doesnt negate all the bad stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198347447937', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 277, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1598324308}
review:
After playing through the first 5 stages of the game, I cannot recommend this game. I will update my review once I finish the game. It's super basic platforming where you collect coins and diamonds to end the level, that is literally it. You can jump on top of enemies to kill them.

I did notice the difficulty ramp up as you get further into the game where things like blood dropping from ceilings are in levels and a few more new enemies. It plays like a classic DOS or Sega Genesis platformer but with absolutely basic aspects.

The one thing it has going for it are the easy achievements. They just keep popping. So if you're buying this game, do not pay more than $0.25 to as high as say, $0.69 for it. That's as high as it's worth imo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016913653', 'num_games_owned': 305, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1121, 'last_played': 1593825327}
review:
Date Written: 07/10/2020

[h1]This Game Isnâ€™t For You[/h1]

TL:DR Too many issues in this game. Donâ€™t waste your time or money.

Canyon capers is a Collectible Platforming game. First, I should say I played all 50 levels. Which is a very small percentage of players based on the achievement stats through steam. There are several issues with this game which make what could have been a difficult game way more difficult.

[list]
[*]The game design isnâ€™t clear. There is too much randomness.
[*]The hitboxes are not accurate on enemies ledges, and the characters.
[*]The jump is floaty.
[*]Dying to instant kills can sometimes put you in a death loop of respawning in a position where the environment kills you instantly again and again and again and again with little chance of escaping.
[*]The art is ugly.
[*]There is no story.
[/list]

I see many reviews suggesting this game for kids. It's not. Give your kids a good game, not this.

For a sneak peak watch my Canyon Capers play through in my Twitch Collections: https://www.twitch.tv/collections/fWYhWPFQHRZYqA

review: Clumsy platformer with clumsy interface. I played through the first ten levels because I thought that was all there was to the game. When the second world loaded I quit. No real satisfaction in churning through simple platforms with awkward enemy interactions and frustrating jump height (usually too low, but sometimes high enough to run into enemies).

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11196, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1569680121}
review:
Canyon Capers is a retro pixel platformer/item collector with a hawaiian theme.   Collect gems and gold from chests while avoiding snakes and green mice.  You can also play soccer and hit targets with the soccerball.

The game displays and scrolls well enough but the gameplay is annoying, being time based and with respawning enemies.  The retro pixel graphic theme isn't consistent and the game would have been better with better graphics, considering you can get older AAA games with 3D graphics for less than the whopping $10 price tag this game has.  I can't recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046595924', 'num_games_owned': 4780, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1551762225}
review:
Canyon Capers is trying to be a retro platformer and to make you feel like you would be playing some of the legendary arcade platformers from 90s only in better graphic presentation. However, instead of taking good concepts and  trying to put them into modern game mechanisms it is taking the worse like time limit and respawning enemies and adding bad level design and clunky control. It is typical example of the game which is rather frustrating than challenging.

Pros: - Solid graphics
         - Attempt to bring retro platforming to modern machines

Cons: - Clunky control
          - Time Limit
          - Bad Level Design
          - Rather frustrating than challenging

I need to give this game Thumbs down and 4 out of 10.

My Video Review can be found here:
https://youtu.be/JXum1fRX8mQ

author: {'steamid': '76561198029781668', 'num_games_owned': 1061, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1554653355}
review:
This game had the potential to be good, but there is a lot wrong with it.

The controls feel floaty, you can find yourself with a really bad respawn loop, hitting enemies and enemies hitting you is very wonky, and even using the menus feels slow.

I have been hit by a rolling rock, which threw me into a boulder, which crushed me, wait for respawn, come back in the boulder, wait for respawn, come back right in front of the boulder, wait for respawn, and then barely make it out before it continued.

Enemies hit boxes are wonky for both your attacks and theirs, though it is simply folloing classic Mario style combat, jump on the enemies to defeat them, hurt from any other way.  I know I've been hit by a snake by a noticable distance ahead of it, as well as when two enemies are in one spot, jumping on them kills one and the other hits you.  If you are hit, you are granted a brief invulnerability window, during which you cannot hurt enemies either, so it only barely helps you.

In menus, there is a delay between each time you move your cursor from option to option.  Unlocking the second character, I found that each character appearently has traits, the first one seems to show where the exit portal is, where the second one is not clear at all, the image shows arrows pointing to gems, which comparing to the first character's image suggest it points out all the gems, instead it sometimes points out gems, and there doesn't seem to be a rhyme or reason which ones.

The levels are simple and fun enough, semi-linear getting bigger and bigger as you progress, but making it so if you want to collect all the pickups on one of the fairly early levels, the biggest one I started, you have to go to nearly the end, and take a shortcut to the beginning. having to go through a somewhat annoying platform section at least twice.

I can see this becoming good, becoming something to enjoy simple fun with, but it is just frustrating, and needs work, which I doubt it will ever get.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015003424', 'num_games_owned': 1489, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1544991967}
review: Canyon Capers is bad, there is no two ways about it. Considering how simple the graphics are, performance is simply atrocious. The way the computer starts to churn as soon as you get into the main menu, you would think you are playing a AAA title. That is the least of the game's problems, because gameplay falls somewhere between dull and infuriating, and starts to lean heavily toward the later as the game progresses. There are five game worlds in total, but you would never know because they all look and play the same. The single annoying music track that plays on a loop will undoubtedly drive most people insane long before they reach the later levels where the game just starts throwing every infuriating enemy and environmental danger at the player at once, without any rhyme or reason to the level design. But then again, most people will probably be bored out of their minds long before the music becomes repetitive. In short, Canyon Capers is not worth a dollar, let alone seven, and is a giant waste of time and sanity.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992029231', 'num_games_owned': 4127, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1526325658}
review:
WARNING: These are initial impressions of the game- my thoughts after a short time of play. Since Steam does not let me denote this, I feel it only fair to put this in the fore of the 'review'.

Disclosure: I recieved this game via a bundle I purchased. This has little or no bearing on my review/impressions- I'd rather play the game and judge it on it its merits, anyhow.

Fun little time waster, objective-based platformer that's really quite a lot of fun in short bursts. Classic 3-star structure on the levels based on what you do/how quickly you finish the level. Level design can be a little cluttered, nothing particularly awful though. Controls are quite responsive, looks to be a mobile port but it runs well so I don't see any problem with that. Had I not gotten this in a bundle I most likely wouldn't have bought it for the current asking price of $6.99- seems to me half that might be fairer (granted I got it in a bundle on a site I trust). Ultimately price is a subjective issue anyhow, not going to dock it to a not recommend for that alone, because ultimately I see many indie devs setting their prices a tad high and that's a whole other ballpark of discussion. Will update if I play further and have more thoughts on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117837119', 'num_games_owned': 3901, 'num_reviews': 178, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1519361031}
review:
Canyon Capers is a 2-D platformer where you go and collect certain items in each of the levels and then a vortex appears and you leave.

The gameplay is alright. The movement is okay, it can be a little finnicky at times though. The jumping is also okay, but not much variation when going with height. In each of the levels, there's different things you need to collect and then other things that you can just collect to increase your score. Each level is rated out of three stars depending on how well you did. There's a total of 50 levels in the game, so quite a bit to the game. The enemies you can bounce on and kill them. Unfortunately, if you get hit by an enemy, you get knocked back and then have an invulnerable state for a little while. First off, the knock back is really annoying because it'll push you away from where you are going, it can knock you off of a ledge, or you can fall into lava or a lava rock, both of which are instakills and it takes a little while to spawn back in. Since the levels are timed, your score gets affected by how fast you do it, so this cuts into that. The invulnerability is okay, only unless you're really trying to get those extra few points from the enemies, but then just end up screwing yourself over by getting hit by them and then you can't touch them for a few seconds. Also, the enemies respawn, which is both a good thing for points, but a bad thing for them getting in your way. Also, there's these timed bomb levels, where if you don't get to the bombs in time, they blow up and you lose the level and have to restart it all over again, which can be a pain. You can choose different characters as you unlock them. The only other character that I found more useful than Dino (the starting character that can show you where the vortex is, which can come in handy in some maze-like levels) is the other guy that has a coin magnet because it can be a real pain getting all of those coins for your extra points.

The visuals are okay and so is the audio. It's going after a kiddy-looking style to appeal to the children, so it's got that much going for it.

Overall, I've played enough of it to get a good idea of what it is. It's an alright game, but it just frustrates me trying to get all three stars in each level. Even if I weren't going for the achievements, I just don't find this game to be too much fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960275943', 'num_games_owned': 2362, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1515095041}
review:
In isolation, this game is fine. The hit detection seems a bit off, but the controls are decent. The levels are just big rooms with obstacles, but the obstacles are reasonably diverse. As an introduction to platformer type games, or for younger players, Canyon Capers is just okay.

However, there are a lot of other games out there which are more deserving of your attention. Just click the Platformer tag check out the What's Popular tab. For example:
Challenging platformers: Cuphead, or Hollow Knight.
Puzzle platformers: [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/238460/BattleBlock_Theater/]BattleBlock Theater[/url], [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/48000/LIMBO/]Limbo[/url], or [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/26800/Braid/]Braid[/url].
Retro platformers: [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/9180/Commander_Keen/]Commander Keen[/url], or [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/15700/Oddworld_Abes_Oddysee/]Oddworld: Abe's Oddysee[/url]

Conclusion: as an adult gamer with a backlog, I wouldn't pay more than a dollar for this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992856964', 'num_games_owned': 1022, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1541473585}
review:
I don't have words for how ugly this phone game is.

Bad hit detection, for both enemies and platforms.

The music's a disappointingly short loop that reminds me of a hoedown.

The level goals are unclearly phrased, and the before-level screens that contain them disappear on a timer, rather than giving you time to read (or skip!) them at your own pace.

I should have stopped at the first sentence.  Just, don't.

review:
2/10 drop it into a canyon and leave it there

My first impression was cute graphics but VERY annoying music&sounds. 

Second impression was, that the style of background, sprites, objects and effects does not completely match which is not as annyoing as ANY sound the game makes but still cringeworthy. 

Third impression was, that the gameplay is uninspired, neither challenging nor engaging in any way.

This is one of the games that you will endure for achievments instead of enjoying it for any reason.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974522156', 'num_games_owned': 4394, 'num_reviews': 794, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1505499873}
review:
Many years ago my best friends fiancÃ© left him for a woman, this devastated him. Being the good friend I was, I dragged him out to a night club where I was trying to get him out of the suicidal depression he had fallen into.

We were drinking at a table when I noticed a very hot woman smiling at me, I noticed she was with a group of friends and she was the only one without a partner at the table. I went back to trying to make my friend have a good time, when one of the males from the table came across and told me that his girlfriends friend would like to get to know me but she's to shy to come over. 

My friend gave me a look that said oh FFS but he said "go on, I'll be ok for a little while"

Anyway I went over to say hello to the hottie and we got on really well, it was when we were on our fifth dance I looked over and saw my friends face. He looked like he was going through hell, so I had to make a decision, stay with this woman or go back to my friend.

I decided to go back to my friend, the hot woman went back to her friends and I listened to my friend question his life choices for the rest of the night.

At around 2am my friend was very drunk and I was about to get him home, when the hot woman was also leaving with her friends. She looked at me and shrugged her shoulders, I grabbed my friend and helped him to his feet. I gave her a shake of the head, she being quite drunk now walked up to me and whispered in my ear "pity as I love it in the arse" 
Then she gave me a smile and left with her friends, I dragged my friend to a cab and went home.

I have regretted that decision ever since, although not as much as deciding to buy and play this pile of shit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111723617', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1500716562}
review:
I doubt anyone ever bought this but I'll tick the box anyway lol.

The instant this game was released it had already aged too much and it just wasn't put together well. Even if you ignore the strange graphical choices which doesn't go together well both the controls and gameplay are quite bad. The fact your character does a weird flip instead of a normal jump is just annoying and the amount of times I slipped off platforms is insane. On top of that absolutely everything gives you knockback as well which only makes some of the more annoying jumps even worse.

Other things would include the complete lack of score inside the level, in fact when you don't need to collect something to win the level it won't tell you how much you've got so its a complete mystery which is a huge red flag for me. In fact there seems to be no explanation to what things do, this includes the characters powers which is just a small picture you have to guess from. 100% not recommended especially at the current price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1495829257}
review:
Tags: Platformer
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Cant believe i got this in a bundle years ago and got the dlc without trying it. Its basically a sidescroll walking simulator where you gather gems. The game advertises you getting points but never shows any indication of it affecting score. Game is cheap all around, with low quality 2D sprites and a sound design that includes fart noises when you jump on ennemies. You play a slow fattie going through generic and straightforward platforms. Except when the game decides do dead end you. In level three I ended up not having any way forward either up or right (I started bottom left) I tried suiciding and I had to run into an enemy a dozen times over before I lost enough health to die. Grade A library clutter bundle shovelware mariolike derivative hogwash

author: {'steamid': '76561198018474955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1494720368}
review:
If you're a fan of this particular retro genre (I typically am), this might appeal. Playing through a few levels, I don't see anything that's been done to modernize the game, unfortunately, so cannot recommend it.

A slider to lower SFX/Music volume was a very basic thing I missed in the game, so had to turn off the audio as I did not enjoy it at the set volume.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011595325', 'num_games_owned': 2476, 'num_reviews': 929, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1493782370}
review:
Canyon Capers Ã© platform bem simples e repetitivo, basicamente vocÃª nÃ£o pode realmente morrer, o objetivo Ã© pegar os itens e sair da fase dentro de um determinado tempo. Basicamente se trata de pular e coletar gemas, as fases nÃ£o sÃ£o muito diferentes. O maior desafio que tive em relaÃ§Ã£o ao platforming Ã© o fato do pulo apresentar bugs e os locais de pulo sÃ£o bem mal colocados. Peguei em um bundle eu acho, da pra passar um tempo, mas se vocÃª quiser gastar grana tem outros jogos do gÃªnero MUITO melhores na steam.
------------------
Canyon Capers is very simple and repetitive platform game, basically you can not really die, the goal is to get the items and get out of the levels within a certain time. Basically it is about jumping and collecting gems, the stages are not very different. The biggest challenge I had in relation to platforming is the fact that the jump is buggy and the jump locations are poorly placed. I picked up a bundle, I think,you can to spend some time, but if you want to spend some money, there are other games of the genre that are MUCH better on steam.

review:
Ist zwar ein netter Indie, im peseudo retro style aber es gibt viele bessere Alternativen welche sich mehr lohnen, sie zu kaufen und zu spielen.
AuÃŸerdem ist die steuerung sehr schwammig und es gibt wenig Abwechslung!
Man kann es probieren und als spiel in seiner Bibliothek sammeln!
Aber man kann auch gut ohne leben.

Was gut ist, es gibt Sammelkarten!

review: I'm 97% this game was made by North Korea for Kim Jung Un's 8th Birthday.  Many Bothans died to bring this game to America.  Pro tip - the fire that's literally everywhere doesn't hurt you, that's just torches.  You don't actually die anyway, until suddenly you do! But you have infinite lives as long as time doesn't run out.  Keep trying little prince!  But hey, it's got steam cards, so sell those puppies and help fund ballistic missile research!

review:
Extremely casual game, which isn't necessarilly a bed thing, but it's not for me.

The fact that the controls are a little floaty and the animation is pretty bad, means I don't recommend playing this game, even if you are just looking for casual fun, there are hundreds of better casual games out there that are worth your time more than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994818580', 'num_games_owned': 438, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1559831415}
review:
I got this for free from a bundle, and like all games, I gave it a fair shot. I got to level 8 before the game became unbearable to play. That's right, EIGHT levels in I had to put my controller down and decide if the hours of idling would be worth it for the cards.  

It's a shallow platformer that's not very worthy to begin with before you add in floaty controls, unnecessary enemy knockback, jumps that require perfect placement or a large portion of the level must be replayed (only up to LEVEL 8, remember), backtracking through said tedious jumps because the coins you're required to collect are on 2 different paths, constantly changing objectives (one level you're collecting coins, the next they're just a bonus while you're defusing bombs, the next is just grab all chests), a bad HUD (health "bar" is a shrinking heart icon with no indicator of actual HP #'s and the timer is just a color-changing line), and pointless mechanics (losing your health just respawns you, why have timed levels, and the enemies are just roadblocks that respawn if jumped on). 

When it gets down to it, Canyon Capers is just jumping, collecting different items in linear levels, and occasionally more jumping on "baddies" that get in your way. That's it. If that's what you enjoy, fire up some NES classics and play something from the good old days that's still good. Not this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998626524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1464648799}
review:
Definitely not recommended.

The graphics and animations are hideous, ugly or nonexistent. What's up with the ridiculously fast blinking eyes in those dark caverns? And one specific cave in like, level 5 or 6 maybe, had enough of them to give someone seizures! The gameplay is far from fun, some enemies are just unfair or broken (like the homing bats) and a tiny mistake can cost you the whole level (like the one with homing bats; the whole level was a really weird and out-of-place difficulty ramp, really).

It feels like a 90's game, and even then it doesn't really have anything to it. Definitely not recommended. If you want a good platformer with the same look (or, well, better look, really), go play Commander Keen series, the older Duke Nukem games, or Crystal Caves. Way more fun, and still pretty challenging, but for better reasons.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048825498', 'num_games_owned': 569, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1458137470}
review:
Juego de plataformas muy sencillo en aspecto y control, en el cual tenemos que coger todos los objetos que nos pidan dentro de un tiempo lÃ­mite. Los objetivos pueden varias en cuanto a lo que hay que recolectar: coger gemas, cofres, explotar bombas, etc.

La traducciÃ³n es de las mÃ¡s lamentables que he visto en mucho tiempo, sacadas prÃ¡cticamente del traductor de google...con razÃ³n hay 8 idiomas disponibles para elegir.

Podemos ir desbloqueando varios personajes conforme avancemos en la aventura, algo que le da un poquito de estrategia al juego, ya que dependiendo del personaje, tendremos una habilidad u otra (posibilidad de ver gemas, inmunes al fuego, etc).

La jugabilidad es extremadamente sencilla: Ãºnicamente tenemos un botÃ³n para saltar. La precisiÃ³n de los saltos es buena, si bien los respawn muchas veces carecen de sentido, e incluso a veces reaparecemos encima de algÃºn enemigo y nos matan sin poder remediarlo.

El aspecto grÃ¡fico, siguiendo la lÃ­nea de lo comentado antes, es tambiÃ©n muy sencillote y para mi gusto bastante feo: la paleta de colores es siempre la misma, los fondos son prÃ¡cticmante iguales, los mundos son extremadamente parecidos a pesar de ambientarse en otros "paÃ­ses", y el diseÃ±o del protagonista y los enemigos es mediocre, sin mÃ¡s.

En cuanto a su dificultad, pasarse cada nivel sin mÃ¡s pretensiones que esa no es muy difÃ­cil, pero conseguir todos los objetivos en todos los niveles, sobre todo a partir del mundo 4, es muy complicado, hasta el punto de llegar a la frustraciÃ³n, ya que es a veces parece que los enemigos y rocas aparecen de la nada, justo cuando tÃº cruzas y sin apenas darte cuenta. Muchas veces ocurre la sensaciÃ³n de que no has merecido morir, pero por "azares" del juego lo has hecho, y eso es lo que hace que poco a poco lo vayas dejando, por lo cansino que resulta.

En definitiva, un juego que no estÃ¡ mal, en el cual puedes pasar unos ratos de entretenimiento decentes, pero que con el paso de los niveles y los mundos va haciÃ©ndose muy pesado, "gracias" a unos mundos extraÃ±amente similares, una jugabilidad muy sencilla sin mÃ¡s posibilidades que la de saltar y una dificultad mal calibrada.

Recomendado para jugarlo un par de horas.... o menos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018112259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1835, 'last_played': 1457747131}
review:
This game is frustrating as fudge.  I hate the boulders and spiky objects that one-shot you.  I hate that the falling spikes can sometimes kill you when you stand above them.  I hate when enemies bounce you into said one shotting obstacles.  I Hate That The Tooltip Before You Start A Level Looks Like This.  I hate the stupid bouncing sound everytime you jump.  I hate that enemies respawn in 5 seconds, especially those mosquitos.  I hate how amateur the game looks for a 2014 game.    I hate that you can't kill enemies during the invulnerability.  I hate that a lot of later levels are earlier levels with a different background and a few extra platforms.  I hate that I still have no idea what collecting the floating hearts does, or why golden snails are the game's special item du jour.  I hate that I'm still finishing this game because I'm a masochist.  I hate the game's annoying music.  I even hate that the game's name sounds like a Donkey Kong Country level ripoff.  I hate that this game is retro but only in the worst possible ways - bad design, bad graphics, bad music, bad controls, bad sound effects, bad enemies, bad obstacles, bad characters, bad objectives, bad likeness to level settings.

Other than that, I really loved the game.  ^_^

author: {'steamid': '76561198087441158', 'num_games_owned': 943, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1428198807}
review:
Una maravilla, espectacular, de que planeta viniste?
Cada nivel es como un cuadro de arte, nos convoca emociones escondidas dentro de nuestro ser.
La forma en la que nos presentan a sus personajes es majestuosa. Mi libro luna de pluton esta siendo un exito en ventas en toda la orbita hispano parlante, lo recomiendo especialmente si lo encuentas con alguna suba en el precio.
Y el juego este es una mierda no lo compren, a mi me lo dieron gratis y vendi los cromos ya esta no sirve para mas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047444685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1604358388}
review:
Endiabladamente dificil, cuesta pasar los 50 niveles con las estrellas que piden, sobre todo por el mal control del personaje, es un reto acabarlo, perdi ganas de conseguir los pocos logros que faltaron al requerir mas perfeccion.
Repetitivo al final, aunque al ser niveles cortos se podian memorizar bien.

Lo peor del juego son los respawn en sitios peligrosos haciendo perder tiempo valioso, algunas trampas estan pensadas a mala leche, acostumbrate a morir empalado, atravesado, agujereado, quemado, pinchado, mordido, defenetrado, aplastado, y muchas formas mas en el mismo templo.

pd: el avance no se me guardo, pero requiere unas horitas acabarlo

author: {'steamid': '76561198052007123', 'num_games_owned': 6824, 'num_reviews': 1311, 'playtime_forever': 1247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1247, 'last_played': 1453721063}
review: Starts as some average to play platformer only to end, after few levels, to being a really boring game. I don't mind cheap looking games, I love every kind of platformers but Canyon Capers is just boring. It have really boring levels design, followed by doing same thing over XX times on few worlds. Jumping animation is bad, you can't land where you really want to, you can't proper jump on enemy heads because you could few pixels off so they will hit you instead. I played it only because got it for free, I wouldn't buy it even at 90% off.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970314107', 'num_games_owned': 2304, 'num_reviews': 917, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1453490539}
review:
If you want to make a game that's just about collecting things, that's fine. There are certainly quality games with simpler premises than that. But if you're not going to go deep on gameplay, you need to go hard on the polish and the feel. A coin collecting game in this day and age needs to be the most incredible, mind-blowing coin collector in the world to make it worth your time. And that makes a pretty good segue into the mess that is Canyon Capers.

You play Dino, a dopey little fellow with an Alfalfa part and the loudest shoes imaginable. He's here to plod across simple levels in search of gems, coins, chests, food, or all four. The first thing you will surely notice is how impossibly ugly this game is. I can't even try to be nice about it, because every level is a trainwreck of sprites and colors. For some reason nothing is rendered at the same resolution, so you might have a photo-realistic tiki mask sitting atop a 16-bit tuft of grass. Not even Dino and the hapless creatures you goomba-stomp (with a farting noise, no less) match. The colors are also rich and garish, clashing against each other and making it impossible to know what is foreground, background, passable, and solid.

Even if the game weren't hideous, the absolutely tepid gameplay would drive you away after only a handful of levels. Every stage is just about collecting things, with no gimmicks or bonus stages to break up the monotony. Sometimes it's one kind of treasure, sometimes it's all four, sometimes it's ticking time bombs, and sometimes it's all optional on the way to the exit. Without exception, you will always be collecting something before reaching the exit. There are no powerups to hasten your lazy stride or let you jump higher than your normal, awkward somersault. Stomping enemies doesn't even gain you anything besides points, because they respawn seconds later.

That reminds me of one of my favorite parts of Canyon Capers, getting constantly hit by strangely unavoidable enemies. Taking damage makes you invincible for a few seconds but also makes you pass through enemies, so you have to stay well away until it wears off. Dying just respawns you nearby, and can absolutely spawn you inside a monster to get hit. Slow enemies are often set in caves where the ceilings are too low to jump them. And even if you come to grips with your awful foes, levels are laid out with ideal paths that make backtracking to collect missed items extremely time-consuming.

There are additional characters to unlock with different passive abilities, but they're specific to one kind of treasure and you don't know what kind you're collecting until you start the level. It's such a simple thing, but emblematic of the shortcomings which riddle Canyon Capers. The game feels like someone's first experiment with GameMaker, slipshod designs and artless aesthetics and all. It's absolutely beyond me to imagine anyone deriving any sort of enjoyment from this game, between its horrifying graphics and infuriating levels.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/audish#curation]curation page[/url]!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046283458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1454099520}
review: A poorly-designed platformer with garish graphics and unintuitive controls and hitboxes. Canyon Capers is not engaging enough to be played for more than a few hours and is certainly not worth its price. It can be entertaining for a little while, but overall does not keep one's attention for long.

review:
Juego patrocinado por el traductor de Google (no es coÃ±a,estÃ¡n sacadas las traducciones de ahÃ­).PreprÃ¡rate para recorrer 50 maravillosos niveles,todos ellos con los mismos escenarios y los mismos objetivos.
Entre ellos se encuentran los enemigos : serpientes,ratas,buitres,murciÃ©lagos,avispas y bichos saltarines deformes.Todos colocados con la mÃ¡s mala leche posible : seguramente si pueden darte un golpe,empujarte por 30 metros y lanzarte hacia la muerte,lo harÃ¡n;los voladores todos atraviesan texturas,y te persiguen medio mapa o vuelan de forma errÃ¡tica y pareciendo haberse metido unas pocas rayas de algo malo.
A continuaciÃ³n tenemos el spawn,que te manda a donde le de la gana el juego,cuanto mÃ¡s lejos mejor,y el de los enemigos,que es de unos 10 segundos o menos.
Luego tenemos las trampas : Hachas colgantes,mazas que aplastan,rocas rodantes,sierras,lava...que con rozarte ya te puedes ir a la otra punta del mapa,y muchas veces jodiÃ©ndote el spawn (en el Ãºltimo nivel hay una que,si mueres en ella,spawnearÃ¡s justo debajo y morirÃ¡s de nuevo eternamente,ojito).MenciÃ³n especial a las bolas rodantes que muchas veces spawnean encima tuya sin posibilidad de hacer nada,o las bolas de lava que parecen tener vida propia y te golpean lanzÃ¡ndote a la lava que finalmente te mata.
En Ãºltimo lugar nos encontramos a los personajes desbloqueables,que no son mÃ¡s que el primero pero con unos pocos cambios a la skin.
En resumen,un juego que sacarÃ¡ lo peor de ti,hay pocos que acaben con mi paciencia,y este es uno de ellos.Y en vez de traducir de Google,es mucho mejor dejarlo en inglÃ©s directamente,al menos no queda tan cutre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031261101', 'num_games_owned': 2317, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1449249283}
review:
||Pros||
*None. There are better platformers to scratch your itch.

*Though I did get 5 achievements for beating the first stage!
..All I got for beating the next few was a headache. :(


||Cons||
*Character jumps like throwing up one of the old, bulky, imbalanced TV remotes, but at a more glacial pace.
Jump is short, there's no double-jump, there's no vertical movement downward through platforms.
Combine that with the jump handling, and expect to keep being sabotaged by the game controls.

*Gameplay is generic, with the collection mechanics of sonic games combined with the platforming of mario games, but with generic, uninteresting levels and terrible handling.

*Art is far worse than it appears in the screenshots. Very grainy, similar colors bleed together.

*Hitbox detection on enemies seems to be off- or maybe it's just another quirk of the terrible tumbling short jump, and you not managing to get the height or angle the game would require to register  proper hit.

*While early stages have you nearly immortal and thus the control frustrations are managable, looking at the screenshots with the handling in mind, I can only imagine later stages to be infuriatingly stressing.

*Don't expect even a basic tutorial- not even to tell you what basic movement keys are.


||Bonus: Pros according to the more helpful other reviews||
*Unlockable Characters
*Unlockable Abilities
*Plays better with a controller
*Doesn't actually slowly descend your soul into a realm of eternal torment [i](Unconfirmed)[/i]

Hop around a stage, collect poorly hidden secrets and a slew of gems and coins, try desperately to clumsily circle around platforms or get the right angle to actually land on an enemy's head..

If it wasn't so painful to play, it'd honestly just be boring with its blandness. 

I just can't recommend this game at all.

1/5

author: {'steamid': '76561197990977338', 'num_games_owned': 2791, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1497275956}
review:
Offensively mediocre.

Not horrible in any single aspect, but this game somehow manages to be less than the sum of its parts. 

Some graphics scale awkwardly, making them blurry. The game feels like a mobile port. There are really annoying, unskippable animations. The game feels very unresponsive in the menus. The style isn't consistent at all.

But worst of all, it's just plain not fun. It feels like a chore.

I do like the little lens flare effect the gems give off and the flip-jump thing. If only that little attention to detail would've been carried over to the UI, level design and overall polish, Canyon Capers could've been a pretty okay game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036403541', 'num_games_owned': 690, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1437715020}
review:
I don't know what it is about this game that I find so unpleasant.
 
Could it be the graphics that remind me of cheap kids birthday party accessories. 

That when the character jumps he spins, albeit there are unlockable characters, I just couldn't be bothered.

Or could it be that the game is not about exploration just jumping around collecting gems in same same looking boxed environments.

I think its the fact that so much work has been put into this game, it seems really polished. It's polished like a tasteless aunties collection of porcelain girl and boy shelf figures. They'll never go on antiques roadshow, they're ugly and they're tacky, but your aunty with the blue hair and voice that grates on your ears love them.

I love Risk of Rain, a game, where you jump around limited environments, collecting stuff and unlocking characters. Sounds similar, it's just that, that game doesn't have a visual style I find nauseating.

I think I'll recommend this game, not because I like it, because we need different tastes, and we need that tacky aunty, with porcelain puppy dogs on her mirror shelves or whatever.

So if you like the visual style, what you'll get it a decent polished game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061249750', 'num_games_owned': 1173, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1430755844}
review:
Canyon Capers is a bit of a mystery to me. It's shockingly polished, with never a hitch during any of my timing playing, imbued with tons of excessive flourishes and admittedly impressive if ill-fitting effects thrown about the level. It's gaudy with it's jump animations just as much as the excessive respawn animations, full of sparkles and swirls that easily distract, and oddly real stock flames that add a sort of surreal touch to the otherwise pixel heavy world. Artistically it is very inconsistant, and with the equally odd choice of stock banjo music blaring over everything, it didn't take long for me to develop a headache. Your character "Dino" also has one of the most excessive healthbars in platformer history, as it takes an estimated 15 hits for you to actually die, which emphasized the baby's first mentality to my naive mind, so I figured spending a mindnumbing few hours waiting for the cards to drop wouldn't be too much to ask.

Of course, it was far too much to ask, for once the tutorial heavy intro levels passed, this game became an eldritch abomination of horrible design choices that would make Ed Wood cringe. Constantly respawning enemies, instant death traps, unforgiving time limits; all wrapped together with one of the most sluggish respawns I have ever witnessed. Just to make it all the more fun, when you die, the clock doesn't stop, so the game quickly becomes a charade of trial and error, and don't even get me started about the homing bats. Not being able to control the height of your jump or the direction in any notable way makes this a genuinely infuriating experience that forgoes all sense of dumb to become something truly abyssal. Combined with the false challenge it present in sheer amount of BS, and you've got yourself a heartbreakingly confused platformer with no sense of direction. The greatest shame of all is that there seems to be a lot of heart put into this, so I can only hope the developers lick their wounds and implement something truly decent. Maybe with a choice in window sizes as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058756521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1442049518}
review:
Dislcaimer: This game has nothing to do with canyons nor caping

Seriously, this game is a disgrace. You're an eleven year old boy that jumps on snakes that fart when they die and when you get hit, it sounds like a fourty year old is motor-boating his wife. You also need a VERY high end pc for the realistic graphics quality... 
The only reason why you would get this game really is because you can get easy trading cards although I'd rather find another way.
This game is only usable as a torture method, I'd rather suck D**K than playing this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064212136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1429068954}
review:
Pros:
-Easy to pick up and play
-Main objective is clear 
Thus concludes the pros of Canyon Capers

Cons:
-"Easy to understand" controls are very simplistic.  You run.  You jump.  That is all.  This could be negated/complimented with solid level design and variety, but instead it brings us to our next point.  
-Bad level design.  I made it through the first world, and there was nothing even remotely new introduced until the end of the world.  You'll be staring at a lot of generic logs my friends.
-Bad gameplay.  The character feels floaty in jumps and overall movement.  This is the bread & butter of a platformer.  It's gotta be right and responsive.
-Music is grating - I was listening to my own music when I started, but decided to see what Canyon Capers had to offer.  I had my music back on in less than 10 minutes.

I could list more cons, but these are the major ones that will sap any minor fun you might have in the first level or two until you realize this is as good as it gets.  

Like many others, I got it for free, and it's been in a bundle or two if I'm not mistaken.  Don't fall for the low price it sells for.  It's not worth it, not even for the low price of nothing I got it for. 

Just, just no.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116517331', 'num_games_owned': 3239, 'num_reviews': 302, 'playtime_forever': 1353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1353, 'last_played': 1429320418}
review: You might think this is a kid's game because it is all colorful and non-violent, but later levels are frustratingly tedious even for an adult.  The sound is annoying and there's occasional hit detection problems, or jumps require too much precision.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993567513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 292, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1427928245}
review:
Generic, casual, simple platformer with no story. You start in the middle of the level and then jump around collecting the required items (and bonus items for extra score) and avoid (instead of kill) enemies. After collecting the items, a portal appears that you need to find and leave before time runs out. Score is somewhat important because you need to have enough stars (up to 3 given per level based on score) to unlock the next batch of 10 levels. For example, to unlock the 4th world you need 22 stars from 10 levels (which means you need to score at least eight 2-star levels and two 3-star levels).

There isn't much variety in levels or objectives- you always have to collect stuff and then exit before time runs out. Music and sound effects are silly but mediocre- I just muted the game and listened to something else while I played.

Controls are decent, and the only thing you can do is move and jump. After clearing all ten levels of a batch, you unlock a character to use. Each character has their own power, though so far they haven't been very game-changing. The starter character shows an arrow pointing towards the exit portal. The second shows arrows towards the last remaining gems on the map, the third has magnet-powers for coins, and the fourth ignores fireballs. There are enemies, but you can mostly ignore them. It takes a bunch of hits to kill you, so the main thing they do is slow you down and knock you off platforms. Falling into lava is insta-death, though you always respawn (though it means more wasted time).

There are definitely more complex and fun platformers around, but maybe this could be okay for someone who is looking for a basic collect-things platformer or as a brain-dead way to pass the time. Not for everyone, since there are many platformers out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041949592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 605, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1487901524}
review:
Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is a Really bad platform game.



[h1]Interface/Menu/Settings[/h1]

You can toggle the Audio (This includes sound and Music) Volume.
There are some different languages available.


[h1]About the game.[/h1]

You have to collect gold/gems in order to complete a level. You are able to get 3 stars in each level. Golden or blue ones. Golden ones are obviously better. Each level has an exit. Which you have to reach. You have a health bar at the top and a time bar at the bottom.

They are trying to make the game funny by adding lame sounds.
Time bar at the bottom.
You are able to unlock other characters... But nobody will play for that long anyway.
The game is cheap but not in terms of money, terrible animation, annoying music, annoying sound.


[h1]Other things.[/h1]

Games like these shouldnt be on steam, but on newgrounds.
They try to act funny with the fart sound whenever you jump on a snake.. or when you take a hit.

-------------------

I Give this game a 1/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197985969658', 'num_games_owned': 1009, 'num_reviews': 689, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1426232652}
review: More and more I see why games with "mixed" reviews get them. This game ruins platforming. You are on a specific time each level, and you must collect part/everthing in the level. All the levels look the same, and the items you collect don't actually do anything. If you get touched you go flying backward, which is always such a stupid inclusion in platformers. The guy jumps terribly and awkwardly. It sucks having every level ruined because you missed 1 tiny item, or how you didn't plan your route perfectly, meaning its trial and error. Another problem is every level is linear, meaning if you want to get to the upper right and you're in the lower right, you have to get to the middle, then go right, then left, then right, and youll be there, because thats the single way to go there, which leads to backtracking. I jsut sick of retrying levels because this isn't a real platformer with progressing levels, objectives, or story. Just collect-a-thon where you need to "collect all gems in 45 seconds or restart level until you can". Busch League. 4/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053243874', 'num_games_owned': 1277, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1425926578}
review:
Honestly would not recommend this game for $7 USD. I had a tad bit of fun after getting it for free while trying to get my cards, but that was all. 
Pros:
-Smooth
-Child-friendly
-Completionist-type game (Collect all the stuff!)
Cons:
-Feels repetitive
-Fires look like they're supposed to hurt you (I spent a good portion of my time avoiding them 'til I accidentally missed a jump and realized that they can't)
-Feels a little more like a flash game.

Overall? 4.5/10. For the price? 2/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028575366', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1425078225}
review:
"Collect this, collect that, I'll give ya something to collect about." 5/10

This game is nowhere near as bad as the majority of reviews on here make it out to be, and I feel like some of the negativity is coming from people who simply just don't like this type of game. Call it lazy, call is uninspired, but a lot of people grew up on games like this one, and sometimes it's just nice to play something that doesn't have you wanting to tear your hair out every ten minutes. Does that mean this game is great? No. But it's really not that bad.

As casual as games come, 'Canyon Capers' is a simple 2D side-scrolling item collecting game, and not a tough as nails super precise platformer. Which I'm sure some people thought that it might be before purchasing it, or deciding to get it in a bundle. Sure it doesn't have the best sound effects, or music, or level design, or art style, or anything really. But you know what? I've played a ton of games that were much worse than this one, and at least 'Canyon Capers' does what it sets out to do; give players the ability to collect coins, fruits, and gems!
 
Sure, this game is extremely basic, as is the level design and overall challenge, but that's kind of what these games are all about. So if you're in the mood to just relax and waste a few minutes, then this game can be an enjoyable experience. Oh yeah, and I'm pretty sure that this game is for children, ya know, kids. But I suppose all of you people who gave this game a negative review hate on 'Reader Rabbit' too, or maybe you thought the movie 'Muppets in Space' was too "juvenile"; well to hell with all of you I say! Now everyone, into the canyon!

review:
"El horror, he visto el horror" decÃ­a Marlon Brando en Apocalypse Now para justificar su exilio. DespuÃ©s de haber jugado Canyon Capers entiendo al completo el significado de semejante frase porque este juego ha salido del mÃ¡s profundo averno del infierno con el Ãºnico objetivo de torturarme.

Estamos ante el claro ejemplo de un juego mal hecho, cuya mÃ¡xima inspiraciÃ³n es conseguir algÃºn miserable eurillo del ignorante de turno que decida comprarlo o de aquel usuario que adquiera el tÃ­pico bundle en dÃ³nde le encasqueten este bodrio sin opciÃ³n a rechazarlo.

El juego pretende ser un plataformero clÃ¡sico cuya misiÃ³n consiste en recoger los objetos de cada pantalla antes de que se acabe el tiempo. Manejaremos a unos ceporros que no pararÃ¡n de dar volteretas al son de sonidos de pedorretas. Los enemigos de toda Ã­ndole reaparecerÃ¡n continuamente y debido a la desafortunada gama de colores, Ã©stos se mimetizarÃ¡n con el entorno matÃ¡ndonos cada dos por tres sin que sepamos cÃ³mo ha ocurrido... El diseÃ±o de los niveles, asÃ­ como de los diferentes enemigos y personajes manejables son mierderos a mÃ¡s no poder.

La guinda del pastel es que la precisiÃ³n con la que se debe de saltar es desquiciante, pues aunque tu personaje llegue a las diferentes plataformas, a veces las atravesarÃ¡ y caerÃ¡ al vacÃ­o. Los desarrolladores no habrÃ¡n ni querido jugarlo para testearlo... y no me extraÃ±a.

Es mÃ¡s asqueroso de lo que parece, en serio...

Canyon Capers estuvo siendo regalado por una web hace tiempo, motivo por el que lo tengo en mi biblioteca de Steam, y me ha sorprendido descubrir que este juego no merece la pena ni siquiera siendo gratis.

Como el juego no es muy largo -40 niveles de corta duraciÃ³n-, pretendÃ­ pasÃ¡rmelo entero y llegÃ³ un momento en que decidÃ­ que no merecÃ­a la pena desgastar las yemas de los dedos manejando al desagradable protagonista de Canyon Capers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055725979', 'num_games_owned': 1326, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 1408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1408, 'last_played': 1424615972}
review:
Un homenaje al Canyon Capers de 1992

Juego perfecto y sencillo, con unas reglas en el control y jugabilidad algo duras, pero acertadas de cara a solventar los problemas de varias formas. Cualquier otra cosa negativa destacada que se pueda decir sobre su representacion, concepto, jugabilidad y control serian incoherentes. Siento hablar asi pero este juego tiene muchas opiniones negativas y por tanto hay que defenderlo a muerte.

-Es un juego de accion, saltos y plataformeo, nada de puzzles y cosas asÃ­. 
-Es un juego estilo retro.
-Es un juego cerrado sobre unas normas, con unos objetivos claros en cada nivel, con el tiempo siempre en contra como maxima dificultad. El estudio del nivel es primordial.
-Es un juego basado en la habilidad con el perifÃ©rico y la localizaciÃ³n en los niveles de lo que tendremos que recoger.

Son 50 niveles dispuestos en plataformas en un espacio cuadrilatero mucho mas grande que lo que vemos en pantalla, en vista lateral 2D, con bichos, trampas y obstaculos, y el salto como unica herramienta para sortearlos. Mezclan la libertad sobre los mismos con lineabilidad, creando un objetivo interesante de cara al jugador en tratar de investigar a grandes rasgos como tratar de resolver el nivel. El tiempo por otra parte, tanto del tiempo restante que nos queda como el tiempo real en la jugabilidad, connotan otro aspecto que se funde con el aspecto o factor de la ''libertad de acciÃ³n'', dÃ¡ndole mÃ¡s fuerza. Podremos buscar la facilidad si por ejemplo somos pacientes a la hora de sortear una trampa o saltar encima de un enemigo, pero el tiempo corre, y tendremos que ir decidiendo en como actuar o correr el riesgo de ser daÃ±ados. Este ejemplo puede parecer eso: un simple ejemplo explicativo, pero lo cierto es que esconde mucha sabiduria y ganas de hacer las cosas bien, por eso matizo o rematizo con esta frase.

El control puede parecer basto e impreciso, pero lo cierto es que se requiere principalmente de la concentraciÃ³n para no cometer errores. Los que consigan ver mas allÃ¡, tomÃ¡ndose el juego en serio, podran apreciar un control muy sencillo en la jugabilidad pero complejo y preciso en la habilidad, y con el factor tiempo y puntuacion imbuidos, consiguiendo una deliveracion para el jugador muy positiva. Este tipo control se funde con los factores de la ''libertad'' y el ''tiempo'' tranformando al juego en '' super guerrero'', como en Goku.

El tiempo, la localizacion de tesoros, los enemigos muertos en forma de puntuacion general, la busqueda de lugares ocultos o secretos, la vida total de nuestro personaje al finalizar el nivel, los distintos personajes a elegir que se van desbloqueando segÃºn nuestra puntuaciÃ³n y el tamaÃ±o de los escenarios y la libertad sobre los mismos, consiguen hacer al jugador doblemente participe, tanto por el camino a decidir de cÃ³mo hacer las cosas como por su lineabilidad propia, y con buen equilibrio. 

Cumple en la dificultad, jugabilidad y control. Altamente recomendado y una gran referencia para el mercado, no puedo decir otra cosa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017200784', 'num_games_owned': 857, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1424244538}
review:
Poor platformer

When I loaded up this game I was expecting a platforming game to the likes 'Mario', based on the art style. What I got instead was something far worse....

Controls are terrible. Pressing the 'W,A,S,D' keys won't move you immediately as there is some sort of delay time. Furthermore, your character movement is slippery and difficult to control. As such you will find yourself constantly falling down platforms and missing jumps foring you to aggravitingly keys won't move you immediately as there is some sort of delay time. Furthermore, your character movement is slippery and difficult to control. As such you will find yourself constantly falling down platforms and missing jumps foring you to aggravaitingly have to redo some platforming just get to where you were before.

Music is forgettable. It adds absolutely nothing to the game. The sound are effects (jumping, opening chests etc) sound like the generic things you here in low budget games.

The story is bad. Basically you are some guy who has to collect some items to escape the canyon through a fortex. That is it!

Graphics aren't so great either. Although I don't mind the artstyle so much, character and environment modles lack detail.

Unless you are interested in achievements and cards, I honestly can't recommend this game to anyone unfortunately.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038604011', 'num_games_owned': 914, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1423416423}
review:
Ehhh itâ€™s alright. But honestly, aside from the artwork being gorgeous, this game really feels like a school project done by a team with that one kid who wants to go 1000% above and beyond the assignment guidelines.
From the sound and music, to the disjointed goals between levels, everything feels very raw. Canyon Capers is by no means an unfinished title, but the polish was done wrong. Through the first 6 levels I had 6 different objectives and between levels even items seemed inconsistent. It was as if one group member liked coins from Mario, one enjoyed gems from bejeweled and the third was a lover of Spelunky chests and enemies. Meanwhile, the overachieving fourth member was busy incorporating all 3 rather than bringing focus to the game.
The game is pretty, the controls are passable, but the sounds are obnoxious and the entire title feels very disjointed and incohesive. Itâ€™s not a pricey game, but Iâ€™m not sure Iâ€™d recommend Canyon Capers even for a few cents.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162033302', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1423169705}
review:
Estamos ante el mejor juego del 2014 y muy posiblemente del 2015.

La historia estÃ¡ a la altura de Skyrim, Metal Gear e incluso los supera en algunos puntos, pero no voy a spoilearos. A los 5 minutos de jugar el protagonista ya le cogerÃ©is mÃ¡s cariÃ±o que a cualquier otro personaje de videojuegos.

El PVP estÃ¡ constantemente actualizado y ademÃ¡s no es P2W para nada, puedes vencer con cualquier personaje.
El juego corre a 600 FPS y 1080 en cualquier ordenador pues estÃ¡ fenomenalmente actualizado. Te puede durar unas 200 horas sÃ³lo el modo historia y siempre estÃ¡ renovÃ¡ndose no es nada repetitivo.

El End-Game consiste en que cada semana meten bosses aleatorios por los mapas y pueden soltarte objetos nuevos.
Y para ser un juego indie tiene 0 bugs es absolutamente perfecto.

Nota Final: 10/10.

En serio es la peor basura que existe, injugable, penoso, ni gratis lo querrÃ­ais.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992981587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1422808812}
review:
Canyon Capers tries to pull off a retro platformer styled gameplay, "brought right up to date". What you really get, however, is a classic example of why bringing up to date needs to be handled very carefully!

Pros:-
- It's fun for about 30 minutes
- You can get it cheap as a part of bundles, and even free if you scout hard
- It has achievements and trading cards
- I guess there IS a "retro" feel somewhere there

Cons:-
- Irritating pushbacks by random monsters (i.e. controls are not the friendliest)
- Bad soundtrack and effects
- Boring after the first 30 or so minutes
- Wash-rinse-repeat gameplay

I got the game for free, and made 21 cents off selling its trading cards... Dunno why I'm complaining!

author: {'steamid': '76561198086073133', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1472140221}
review:
Why is this garbage even on Steam.

Canyon Capers is a, "is a retro style platform game brought right up to date, with tons of levels, modes, collectables and secrets." The levels are terrible and repetitive, the modes don't bring very much into the game, collectables are annoying, and the secrets are so... unsecret (for lack of a better term) they might as well have a giant sign saying, "COME HERE, I'M A SECRET, BUT DON'T TELL ANYONE!" 

Don't
get
me
started
on
the
"artstyle"

It's a bunch of reused, terrible textures. When you put them next to each other it looks even worse. 

Platformers are suppose to have tight, cutting edge, controls. Or a least decent ones? CC has floaty, slow, and clunky controls which are most of the time to difficult to use and caused many pointless deaths.

This game isn't fun. This game shouldn't be on Steam. It's a joke.
Zero out of ten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018307765', 'num_games_owned': 1649, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1422080809}
review:
I'm not sure how to put this lightly, but... Canyon Capers feels like a flash game. Like, a poorly designed flash game at that. You run and jump, you pick up collectables, you reach the end of the level. That's it. I realize games like this were rather popular a while back, on sites like Newgrounds and in truly retro-style games on NES, but... There's a reason we've evolved beyond this crud. Games that try to pull off retro need to be able to do something satisfying, fun, or interesting, like Fez or VVVVVV. It compensates for the pixely and simple design. Mindlessly collecting shit isn't satisfying. Linear progression through jump puzzles isn't fun. Lifeless music and bland character models with no plot isn't interesting.

I usually play a game for two hours before deciding whether to shelf it or continue. I couldn't make it past half an hour. Avoid like the plague --and that goes for you too, fans of platformer and retro games. There's so much more out there that deserves your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108183039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 256, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1422057213}
review:
Looks like a port of an IOS game and feels like it.

The game itself isn't that bad. You basically go around and collect what the level wants you to collect and leave. The controls are pretty easy and simple and the levels are all different. This is where the positive things end.

The enemies reappear which isnâ€™t bad at first but as you die and are spawned RIGHT ON TOP OF THE RESPAWNED ENEMY AND THEN GET KNOCKED OFF THE PLATFORM DOING THE WHOLE THING AGAIN, you get very frustrated. Additionally, each level has 3 stars (like a mobile game) and you need a certain amount of stars in the current 10 levels to move the next 10 levels.... which is stupid and arbitrary and it just pissed me off to the point where I quit the game.

Just leave it. Buy something else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030310227', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1663833364}
review:
The price is to expensive for this Adventure.

[h1]PRO:[/h1]
+ Nice Retro Style
+ Can choose from several Character's Afroboy, Dotty's etc...
+ Wolrd Stats
+ Several Gamemodes
+ Steam Trading Cards


[h1]CONTRA[/h1]
- very hard to get 3 stars on each map on each World
- bad sound effects
- DLC for 2.00euro, even in Grid Autosport the Drag DLC is cheaper

[h1]CONCLUSION:[/h1]
There are other better Retro Style Games. In my opinion go for another one.

review:
No se por donde empezar... a ver...
Este juego es uno de esos que no te cabe la duda que pudo haber sido creado en GameMaker por niÃ±os de 12 aÃ±os sin conocimiento alguno de programacion.
Es simplemente una burla, un desperdicio de tiempo que tiene problemas de grandeza.

Osea... a ver... no es que sea malo ni que tenga muchos bugs, es que simplemente esta idea se ha visto 10000000 veces, es un simple juego de plataformas con una dificultad deficiente que pone a prueba tu resistencia para soportar ataques graves de progeria.

Aun asi supongo que puede divertir a los mas pequeÃ±os (NiÃ±os no mayores de 2 aÃ±os... que si no despues salen retrasados). Pero sigue siendo un asco de juego para una persona normal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014163253', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 388, 'playtime_forever': 992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 983, 'last_played': 1421027056}
review:
[b][u]-Quick Review-[/u][/b]
Cayon Cappers is a 2D plat former that usually handles pretty well, you unlock other characters as you get higher scores on levels (by unlocking stars). The whole concept of this platformer is to "collect all the things", after you collect the required items a portal opens and you finish the level.
[b][u]-Detailed breakdown review-[/u][/b]
[b]Story:[/b]  I'm under the impression that you're an explorer, inside a canyon, capping gems, coins, fruit, and treasure boxes. There are 10 levels in each world, and 5 worlds to play through, each with their own "theme". Don't get too excited though, I saw little to no change in environment, only scaling difficulty at a dramatic rate, and different music.
Most platformers don't have much of a story, you're supposed to like them because of their gameplay. Sorry, your princess is in another castle. There really isn't much else to say about the story, it's uninteresting, if barely existing at all.

[b]Game Play:[/b] I heard a great man once said, "There's a difference between difficulty, and a broken game." (I think it was either JohnTron, or ExtraCredits) As much as I wanted to hate Cayon Cappers for being a hard game, I didn't hate it until I ran into glitches.
I would say 90% of the game is glitch free, but I ran into glitches that would respawn me in a kill zone, (aka: I would spawn and then insta-die. Good stuff) this type of failiure is one of the most frustrating that any gamer would need to endure. One particular spot on the LAST LEVEL of the LAST WORLD, I was killed and ran out of time while a bomb ticked to my immanent failure, because I kept respawning under a swinging axe blade of death.  ...After something like that you can only quit the game before you go Super Saiyan from Rage.

 [b]Achievements:[/b] The first few achievements are freebie's, you literally get one for just playing called "the easiest achievement you will get". The toughest achievements are the "complete 100%" type. So if you're aiming for achievements this is doable, but only if you're good at platformers. I would originally say "this is an easy 100% for achievements", but I have reversed my opinion since world 4. I now lack 3 stars on one level: the last one. I have gotten 9000 points and still haven't gotten 3 stars. (finished it about 3 times)

 [b]Price:[/b]  I got this game for free, so I can't complain too much here, but the price for Canyon Cappers $6.99, which is a pretty high price, but if you know you love playing all playformers, you can probably make it worth it. But it would be best to get the game on sale.

 [b]Conclusion:[/b] I initially thought "yes! a playformer I can beat", but since the last two worlds were so brutal, my disposition has soured for this game. Additionally this game just make me feel bad for being bad, because the characters have huge smiles on their faces, and each jump is a flip.
To recap, the story was  nonexistent. the gameplay was painful. Achievements were pretty doable (and at times the only motivation for me). The price was reasonable. This game will appeal to people who love platformers and can over look a "childish" graphic style.

review: okay we started this game up with great expectations sat patiently as it installed microsoft driver softwear it booted up and we were greeted by the soft but pleasent hum of gentle farm music press play and the map launches and suddenly...HELLFIRE THE MUSIC DESCENDS TO HELL WITH A CONSTANT SATANIC DRONING AND HUMMING THE SCREEN GOES BLACK BUT THE DRONING CONTINUES ON AND ON DRILLING INTO OUR HEADS AND THEN BLUE SCREEN AND THE COMPUTER RESTARTS...i to this day do not know what happened on that fateful night but what i do know is...BEST FUCKING GAME EVER 10/10 - IGN (International gaming network) thank you for your time and peace out
