author: {'steamid': '76561198001071840', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1420744669}
review:
[b]Short review:[/b] [u]Don't buy this game, even on sale. This game is bad.[/u] I got the thing for free, no idea how, and will be deleting it off of my pc because I would rather have the empy hard drive space than own this game.

[b]Controls:[/b] I don't know what people consider to be accurate terms for describing controls. Tight? Loose? Responsive? Floaty? The only way I can think to describe this game is "slippery". Your character controls like... other characters might in an ice level of a traditional platformer. Playing through eight levels of this game, I never got a handle on how the character actually controlled. When I jumped a gap I hoped they'd land where I wanted them to go, but could never feel certain. Vertical jumps were hit and miss; I'd make ones I didn't think I could, and miss ones I thought should have been easy.

But what about the character's attacks or special abilities? I can't comment on that because I have no idea if there even are any.

[b]User Interface:[/b] It is at an absolute bare minimum. This game looks like it was made for a smartphone, with five massive buttons on the splash screen, all of which are just symbols. Want to know what the controls are, or change them? Too bad, no button for that. At least, not one that's readily apparent. Games don't have to have prompts to tell you how to do every little action all the time, but at the very least you should be able to look up your control scheme.

The hud is fairly bad. Your health-meter is a giant heart on the top-right corner of your screen. I have no idea how many hits I can take before I die, because it just gets smaller. You'll never be looking at it anyway, as it's pretty much opposite of the level time which is just a counting-down progress bar at the bottom of the screen. So yeah, everything is just vague.

[b]Art style: General:[/b] Many of the elements of the UI and such look like they were made in Flash. Now Flash can be a great and amazing program; when I say "made in Flash" I mean "made in Flash and put on Newgrounds in 2002". Much of the art uses things like oval tools and such in it's construction, such as the cow-head logo. You know, like you'd use to make art in MS Paint? It looks lazy and amateurish.

[b]Art style: Character:[/b] Character looks like they took a larger image and resized it at an unequal aspect ratio. No one wants to play as an ugly character unless you're playing a next-gen first/third person shooter ooh-rah.

[b]Art style: Enemies:[/b] Some of the enemies look alright, but many of them are things like little green mice and other cute things. They look like they should be rescued by you, not that they'll harm you. Hit boxes are fairly hit or miss as well.

[b]Art style: Level / items:[/b] You know, this is where the game is best... or least-worst. A lot of the art elements for the level design actually look pretty great. But there's a mixture of styles. You have these great shaded in-depth elements like rock pillars and platforms, or treasure chests, then off-set by cartooney coins or very flat-looking mine carts. It looks like several different people worked on different art elements and they just combined them together, rather than working together with one specific art style. It took me about four levels to realize that the pillars of flame shooting from the ground wouldn't hurt you but were actually just torches to light your way.

[b]Level design:[/b] It's just platforming, nothing too amazing, right? Well there are parts where the game screws this up too. Some areas are only accessable by one route. That's fine for extra stuff, but when you have to transverse 2/3rds of the level to reach an area, then fall due to the poor controls, and have to start over again... in a game that's focused on timed treasure collection, that's fairly inexcusable.

[b]Story:[/b] As far as I know, there isn't one. But games don't always need a story if they're fun. But since this game isn't fun the lack of story harms it more.

[b]Playstyle:[/b] There is no consequence for dying. There isn't a lives counter and your health meter is totally ambigious. So you could die a few times in a level and not even really realize it. When you do die, you often respawn in odd locations; there are no obvious check-points.

When you are hit by an enemy you have invincibility frames, that's pretty great right? Except that you can't hit enemies during those frames either. So you may get hit by an enemy and then try to jump on another enemy, only pass through that enemy and "rematerialize" inside of them, which makes you take another hit. And sometimes you just go invisible, which isn't great in a game where you can't control your character very well when you CAN see them.

Oh and remember those minecarts I mentioned earlier? In other games you'd jump in one and it would "catch" you, like a bucket. Not in this game. You can slide or walk out the side of them. That's just poor programming.

[b]Final verdict:[/b] There are elements here that could make for a good game, if more time had been applied, more experience been used... I really don't know. I can't tell if this was made by amateurs who gave it their all, or by a company that just slapped something together to try and make some quick cash. That's the boggling thing about a game like this; you don't know if it's failures should be depressing or infuriating.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960330488', 'num_games_owned': 731, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 958, 'last_played': 1449584453}
review:
Canyon Capers, apperently an (inofficial?) sequel to an old game with the same name, is a simple [b]plattformer[/b], where you jump through [b]50 levels[/b] to reach the exit-vortex in time. In most of the levelâ€™s game modes you have to open this vortex by doing one of three different quests: 
-	Gather all items of one kind (thereâ€™s gems, coins, treasures and food)
-	defuse all bombs in the correct order (within an extra-timelimit for each bomb)
-	pick up EVERY item to please the gods and collect their favor. 
In the fourth and final game mode, the vortex is already opened and you just have to reach it, while collecting as many items as possible.
While doing so, you have to deal with a strict [b]timelimit, traps and monsters[/b] (which you can usually kill by jumping onto their head) and a leveldesign of increasing difficulty.

Thatâ€™s basically what you do for 50 levels, and after a short while it gets really [b]repetetive[/b]. The different game modes really donâ€™t change much, especially if you want to reach a 3-star-rating for each level. In this case youâ€™d have to collect every item anyways, so it doesnâ€™t really matter, which game mode the level has.

Additionally there are situations where you simply die because of weird design-choices, for example when you respawn in the path of a trap, which hits you just as you respawn. Fortunately, youâ€™re usually able to escape after one or two deaths, but there are situations which just donâ€™t feel â€˜fairâ€™ to the player.

Technically the game has a lot of flaws aswell. The [b]graphics are okay at best, the music is terrible[/b] (and after 14 hours of gameplay Iâ€™ve failed to find a way to lower the volume, there's just a mute-button) and the [b]localisation is just awful[/b]. Apparently they used google-translator for almost every language, which makes anything besides english un-readable.

[b]Despite that, the game is not terrible. Itâ€™s just not good either. Itâ€™s definitely doable to finish the game in maybe 6 hours, with all achievements it might take 12. The question is: Do you really want to invest that much time (and 6$) in a subpar game, when there are so many better games to play.

On a scale from 1-10 Iâ€™d maybe give it a 3.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198019182885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1419626601}
review:
No soy de mucho criticar los juegos porque todo tiene su trabajo al fin y al cabo, pero este juego me ha hecho reir con su trÃ¡gica traducciÃ³n tipica del Google Translator. Su interfaz no engancha, y el juego de por sÃ­ tampoco. 

Se salva de mi peor calificaciÃ³n por los cromos.  Pero aun asÃ­ no lo recomiendo para comprar... lo siento

author: {'steamid': '76561198001437365', 'num_games_owned': 772, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1422828197}
review:
I might have been able to make it through the game if it weren't for the timer. Failed that section of platforming? Well you have to do it over again because there's whatever collectable you need up there. Oh, you did one moderately annoying section first? Well the exit's at the end of it, so you have to do it again. All within a time limit. And there's a horribly annoying beeping noise when your time is running low that lasts way too long, so have fun with that too.

It's not that I don't like games with timers, it just doesn't seem to work with the game design. If the game were a left-to-right get-to-the-end sort of thing then yeah it would make sense. But this is a get-all-the-things platformer where you can choose the order in which you get said thing, so basically if you go the wrong way first, you have to start over.

The music is unremarkable. The level design looks like it could be interesting, but the timer makes it so I can't really appreciate it.

I get that it's going for a retro style, I think maybe Canyon Capers is leaning a little too heavily on that. Other games have taken the retro aesthetic and retro gameplay, but combine those with modern gameplay advances to make actual, enjoyable games.

There was a time when this sort of game probably would have been enjoyable, but that time has passed and I think we are much better for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041980449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1420147308}
review: I don't usually write unfavoriable reviews, because 1) who am I to tell you what you should or shouldn't like? and 2) the people who make the games, even ones that don't turn out great in the end still spend a lot of time and effort crafting the best game they can. This isn't the case with this game. There is nothing here that says "we worked hard to give you something you'll enjoy". This game reeks of "give me the money". I got this for free, it took 2 minutes to download, and it takes almost no space up on my hard drive, and I still feel like I got monumentally ripped off. I played this game so you don't have to. Trust me, this game is for no one.

review:

Turns out the game doesn't tab out and instead prefers to sit in front of anything you've got running in the background while it sits there idle. 0/10 wouldn't recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021009654', 'num_games_owned': 2452, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1420054026}
review:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Spiel: 

Ein Jumpâ€™nâ€™Run Spiel was eher auf Facebook gehÃ¶rt als auf Steam.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Einzelspieler:

Man HÃ¼pft durch Zwei Handvoll an Stages und bewerkstelligt die langweiligen Suchaufgaben. Das Springen ist die einzige Sache die der â€Heldâ€œ kann und das nichtmal sehr gut. Das Springen funktioniert bei Gegner mal und manchmal auch wieder nicht, die Plattformen sind immer sehr nervig zu erreichen da sie zu eng aneinander liegen.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Grafik:

Die Grafik soll Oldschool wirken tut sie aber leider Ã¼berhaupt nicht.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Musik:

Musikalisch ist hier garnichts zu erwarten.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Steuerung:

Die Steuerung hat gut mit meinem XBOX 360 Pad funktioniert nur die Umsetzung war halt schlecht. 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Pro/Contra:

+ Trading Cards
- Level sind einfach schlecht
- Gegner sind Nervig und langweilig 
- Missionen sind alle gleich
- Spielzeit ca ne 1h 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Fazit:

Dieses Spiel ist keinen Cent Wert, es macht einfach keinen Spass. Wer schonmal ein gutes Jumpâ€™nâ€™Run gespielt hat wird hier keinen Spass haben. Ich rate jedem ab das Spiel zu kaufen oder zu spielen.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Zusammengefasst: 

Einzelspieler: 2/10
Grafik: 5/10
Musik: 1/10
Steuerung: 7/10
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Spiel: 4/10

review:
Un semplicissimo platform, senza alcuna pretesa: la trama Ã¨ inesistente, lo stile grafico non ha la minima personalitÃ  ed il level design Ã¨ penoso. Per non parlare del gameplay, monotono e noioso, che di certo non invoglia a finirlo o perlomeno di giocarci una volta ogni tanto per perdere tempo.
Ci sono F2P molto migliori, per non parlare delle innumerevoli app gratuite per cellulari che lo surclassano in tutto e per tutto.
Io l'ho ricevuto in un bundle e non sapevo nemmeno di possederlo, e credo che dopo aver ottenuto tutte le carte (che venderÃ²/scambierÃ²) rimarrÃ  a 'fare la polvere' nella mia libreria di Steam.
In poche parole: non lo consiglio ad anima vivente :).

review:
Though well-meaning, I can't help but feel as though I'm playing the first game someone made in flash, when they were in high school, in the early 2000s - something I might see on an early newgrounds.

I could understand this being released as freeware, but for almost $8 on steam this feels completely out of place. Sorry CrazyMoo, but there's no way this is a retail game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048446245', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1419637944}
review:
As I am writing this, Canyon Capers is actually running in the background. Why you ask? Well, for the sole reason that everyone else has had to "play" this game - getting the card drops. That is why you'll see almost all people have a total play time of ~2 hours on this game.

Now, I'd like to take a moment right here and applaud myself for actually having actively played this game for about 50 minutes. While that already caused me to contemplate suicide multiple times, it is nothing compared to the insanity that one must be facing, if you were to keep playing this game for any longer. 

Circlejerk aside, this game really is absolutely garbage. Let's be really lenient, though, shall we? 
[list]
[*]Let's forget about the endless misspellings and the unintelligible grammar 
[*]Let's forget about the fact that the enemies' hitboxes are worse than that of LeBlanc's E
[*]Let's forget about the fact that the developers had the audacity to charge more than A BIG FUCKING TAG SAYING "FREE TO PLAY" for this game.
[*]Let's also disregard that there's literally zero explanation as to what different items and objects do, cause, and are supposed to represent.
[/list]

Let's just scrap all that, and be more biased than an American court in Alabama during the time of racial segregation. Even then, I could not recommend this game without hating myself. The game is so simple and boring with the most repetitive and retarded level design that I've ever seen. When I was 10 I downloaded software that didn't require any programming or design knowledge whatsoever to create your own simple platformer games - even those fucking miserable attempts at creating something like a "game" were better 10/10 material than this piece of horse shit. 

All in all, I'm happy I got this game for free through IndieGala, because at a current value of 4 card drops X 9 cents each, I made a damn good profit off of this (well relatively, if I lived in Eritrea or Somalia).

[b]Rating: 6/9[/b], would actually force a girl to choose me, if she had to decide between playing this game or making out with me.

review:
This game could be a flash game online and not on steam with a price of 6 euros. It plays like a mobile game. Get it only as part of a bundle or for free (my case).

You do nothing except:
-collecting gems
-collecting gems
-collecting coins
-collecitng more coins
-open chests
-jump on enemies

REPEAT
BOOORING

author: {'steamid': '76561198012537788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1419041577}
review:
Pros:
-I got it for free

Cons:
-I had to make a PlayFire account to get it randomly from a list of other games
-terrible graphics that look like a flash video from 1999
-seriously, the logos and the text headers are terrible. This looks like a bootleg game.
-slippery controls for a platformer. There's too much momentum when you move and you slide all over the place
-the music is attrocious. It loops the same midi organ track over and over
-poor level design
-the character looks like a potato

Overall:
-this game is shit

review:
I got mixed feelings on this one.

It's not that bad, but it's not good either.
Bad graphics, you can only jump, and the jump animation is pretty silly.
It's challenging, but it doesn't provide you that fun time you wish to had while playing a game like this.

Not worth buying, but if you grabbed it for free, give it a try

author: {'steamid': '76561198100988228', 'num_games_owned': 1253, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1418921055}
review:
Playing Canyon Capers is like playing Super Mario because of the theme, music ( pretty much ), and the gameplay. What I liked about the game is that it's fun and exciting as you unlock more characters and levels. The levels on World 1 is pretty easy but it gets harder and harder as you unlock more levels which would be quite frustrating to finish with a 3 stars (high score). I liked the characters too, without those characters it won't be fun because it gets boring afterwards.

The annoying part is that when you get on to level 5 or something which has the lava thing. When you get hit by the furball and fall in the lava, you'll respawn to the top lava area and unluckily, you will get hit again lool.  

So if you're looking for a game which is good for an hour to play, better try this out. 6/10

review:
Eh, it's OK. It's not the best, but it's not horrible. It's kind of fun, but level 7 or 8 or so is really frustrating so I don't care about beating it anymore.

Other than some questionable level design, the game is quite fun, and I'd beat it if that level wasn't in there. The art of the main character sucks, though, but the game's a bit better than the cover.

This gets a very light recommendation. You probably have one from a bundle, so go ahead and play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101887130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1418165643}
review:
[u]Summary Review[/u]
Hope you like hearing farts, because that is what this game is: a giant fart.

[u]Detailed review[/u]
You play as Dino, a knight that's gone full blown potato and dawdled into a vortex of wacky mischief, and your objective is to collect the required items and enter the vortex into more bull shit adventures before time runs out on the bottom of your screen to (sometimes) please the gods.

"Why are you pleasing the gods?"

Well...I don't know. More importantly, why are you potato?

Canyon Capers is your classic platformer, except you're allowed to get hit more than once and (from what I've seen so far) allowed to die infinite times, which defeats the purpose of all the extra hearts that you can find lying around the stages.

Dying is not the kicker though. Your real enemy is the clock.
If time runs out before you can gather all the items, you'll have to start over collecting everything for that stage, which can range from "Oh, that's not so bad" to "FML".

One of my personal least favorite platformers to date is a game called 8BitBoy.
So when I saw this game, I said to myself "Huh...will this game make me appreciate 8BitBoy...!?"

I went into playing Canyon Capers expecting to be monstrously more disastrous than the other indie platformer I've mentioned, and honestly...it wasn't as bad as I expected, but it's still pretty terrible.

I expected this game to one shot you and make you start over from the very beginning, but this game is actually kind enough to start you back up from where you last stood a few seconds ago, which is something I really appreciate over 8BitBoy's death mechanics.

However, two of the biggest turn offs in this game are the designs for this game and the SFX.
Designs amazingly look worse when in motion versus looking at them through screenshots, and the SFX is something to be undesired.

When you jump on snakes, they make fart noises.
I don't know why that's even a thing.

It was amusing for the first snake or two, but then I got incredibly annoyed by the noise immediately.
And then there's the BLBLBLBLBL SFX when you get hit. Just as annoying as the fart noises, and it comes more frequently as you progress.

In the end, I came here expecting to be disappointed, and the results did not disappoint.

So yeah. Unless you're just here for the steam cards, stay away from this game.
And if you were planning to buy this, [b]definitely[/b] stay away from this game, and save that money to buy something more worthy.

You want a retro platformer with challenges that badly?
Look up "You have to win the game."

That game is free on steam, and is by far one of the best retro platformers I have ever come across, and you'll definitely get a kick playing an hour or two with that game versus this potato of a platformer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984322112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1417900590}
review:
Need an option between recommend and no recommend. This game is not great, and it not terrible. It is somewhat interesting though dose nothing unique, you either collect a an item, and others are for higher score, collect bombs in a certain order before a short timer runs out, or collect all 4 type of items to open 4 doors. 

Having health is pointless, only in a couple maps I had to try not to get hurt to get 3 stars, others it made it easier to get hurt (you get a few second invulnerablity). a few things kill you instantly, game often put you right on an enime or swinging axe you you die again right away.

If some flaws in a game make you angry, I would skip this. If you like achievements, this one is easy to get all the achievements. I would rate it 5/10.

review:
Canyon Capers est probablement le jeu recordman des jeux qui ont Ã©tÃ© le plus distribuÃ©s gratuitement Ã  travers des bundles, celÃ  pose de sÃ©rieux doutes sur sa qualitÃ©. 
Qu'est-ce qui lÃ¨ve les doutes ? Jouer Ã  Canyon Capers... 
Le gameplay tourne autour du fait d'Ã©voluer dans des niveaux au design chiant avec un perso qui a la maniabilitÃ© d'un rocher pour ramasser le plus de merdouilles possibles cachÃ©es aux 4 coins de la zone, des piÃ¨ces, des fruits, des diamants, des coffres, ou bien dÃ©samorcer d'occasionelles bombes tout en sautant sur la tÃªte de tout le bestiaire avec ses sprites hideux (serpents, abeilles, rats, poissons, tout est moche). 
Si vous faites un assez bon score sur le niveau, vous obtenez des Ã©toiles, et si vous avez assez d'Ã©toiles dans une zone, vous dÃ©bloquez la zone suivante, et vous avez le plaisir de pouvoir continuer Ã  refaire toujours la mÃªme chose dans des niveaux qui veulent de plus en plus vous pousser Ã  bout. 
On attend avec impatience la fin, mais Ã§a ne semble jamais se finir, les niveaux continuent d'arriver puisqu'il y a 5 stages de 10 niveaux Ã  terminer, et que tous ces niveaux sont intÃ©gralement basÃ©s sur le mÃªme gameplay dÃ©pendant de cette maniabilitÃ© terrifiante. 
On dÃ©bloque bien quelques persos avec un "pouvoir" supplÃ©mentaire ici et lÃ , pouvoir qui se rÃ©sume pour la plupart Ã  vous filer un radar pour un seul type d'objet/merdouille Ã  ramasser, afin d'abrÃ©ger un peu vos souffrances. 
Le jeu est donc dÃ©finitivement mauvais, ce qui n'est pas exactement une nouvelle fraiche, Ã©tant donnÃ© qu'il Ã©tait le remake d'un trÃ¨s vieux jeu de l'Ã©poque DOS/Amiga qui Ã©tait dÃ©jÃ  trÃ¨s mauvais Ã  l'Ã©poque, et que le travail fait sur le portage n'a absolument pas essayÃ© d'amÃ©liorer tous les dÃ©fauts du jeu, ce qui aurait Ã©tÃ© infiniment plus utile que d'ajouter des achievements steam et des trading cards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027872861', 'num_games_owned': 1356, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1415932538}
review:
I wish there was an option to give a neutral review....

Not the most spirited way to start off reviewing a game, but I figure, no use beating around the bush.

This game is not bad..necessarily; and it's not unoriginal either...again, necessarily.  However, the game feels like bonus stage from the SNES days gone wrong, pitting you in a semi-small playing field with baddies as obstacles, where it is your objective to collect coins, gems, and or treasure chests, all while racing against the clock, jumping from platforms and structures in platformer perguatory.  

Currently, I have not played through much of the game, but from the 6-7 levels I have completed, they all feel the same in a copy/paste then edit sorta feel.  It truly is a different type of platformer, at least to me, but I can't say after several levels I am truly compelled to continue forward.  That being said, I have been wrong about games before by judging them too quickly, so I feel like I owe the developers at least a fair playthrough of the full first world before speaking ill of their product.

That being the case, I give my vote to recommend, at least till I give it a full fair shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116580413', 'num_games_owned': 671, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 661, 'last_played': 1691954021}
review:
Confusing textures, really annoying music, turned off the music right when I heard it for a few minutes. Levels were Mario style, got 3 stars in levels like Angry Birds. Levels aren't that bad, overall, if you keep up with the textures, they are fun to play. They could have made the game physics better, IMO.
Overall, enjoyable when you have time to kill. Not worth the money, but, not a bad game either.

Oh, it has Trading Cards which is nice, as well. So that's a hefty bonus and a pro if you think about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054894220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1428430979}
review: This game is only for true hardcore gamers. Stay away if you're used to casual toilet games like Deus Ex or ArmA. This is a real, hardcore, thought provoking game that requires intense strategy and foresight that the human brain completely and utterly lacks. This is the kind of game Steven Hawkin would have a hard time with. The only game series that is more thought provoking and strategetic than this is the Leap Frog series... That's how hard this is. I only recommend this if you have a lot of time on your hands and look forward to investing lots of time thinking and planning out your every move.

review:
I think speedrunners would like this game.

Everyone else, wow, no.

Sound design and music is grating and the action is basically a giant set of collect-a-thons.  There's very little satisfying about the missions.

Overall, more frustrating than fun.  Grab the cards and then uninstall it.

[h1]In-Depth:[/h1]
Canyon Capers is quite a below-average platformer. Graphics aren't "retro", they're plain bad, as they couldn't do anything better. Music and especially SFX are annoying and there are gamebreaking bugs. The map layouts and designs are boring. Why the 6â‚¬ price tag, with a 2â‚¬ DLC? I don't know.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029140502', 'num_games_owned': 712, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1415643627}
review:
As soon as I turned on this game and saw logo, I knew it's gonna be bad. Main menu music only confirmed my supposition.

- graphic is awful, looks worse than on screenshots, I really think I saw better looking games on NES
- music is annoying
- jumping is a joke, you're never sure if you jump over to next platform or not
- oh, you didn't reach it? Run through whole level again
- and once you run the same path for the fifth time remember that you have limited time! Nice, isn't it?
- every level objectives are "collect tons of stuff and go to exit"
- enemies renew themselves after like three seconds
- using alt+tab will cause a serious technical problems making this game unplayable and almost impossible to shut down

Pros? I got it for free and got cards, including my first foil card.

Please, save yourself the time and don't play this game. Really.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965680285', 'num_games_owned': 939, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1415574661}
review:
Got it free and I still feel like I paid to much. This game sucks so bad I want to find a way to remove it from my steam list. They should be paying me for the time I spent in this game. In fact if you want to obtain the same experience as playing this game for 0.7 hours just hit yourself in the skull and crotch at the same time for that amount of time and you'll be close.

- Terrible Graphics (not retro just terrible)
- Terrible Controls
- Later levels have objectives that are near impossible (not completely, but close enough to make you say "fuck this game")
- Music is like nails on a chalkboard
- The "auto-jump if the button is being held" is counter to every single platformer on the market where holding the button makes you jump higher. This means when you hold the button expecting to jump higher you instead instantly jump once you land causing you usually to kill yourself. 
- There is no "jump higher" and there are ledges that are like a millimeter too high and force you to retrace the entire level to hopefully make a jump ... if you don't be prepared to travel the whole level again.
- All those annoyances are thrown into a game where each level has a very short time limit. So you feel rushed and frustrated from the second you begin playing.

Just avoid this game like the plague ... if you have the chance to get it for free, treat it like you would "Free Herpes."

author: {'steamid': '76561198033663691', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 809, 'last_played': 1415119922}
review:
Crazy Moo Games' "Canyon Capers'' is like an erotic daydream about chances missed and opportunities avoided and springed. For its hero, who spends several nights wandering in the sexual underworld, which are the 5 ancient worlds, it's all foreplay. He never actually has the 'treasure', secretly meaning sex, but he dances close, and holds its hand in the flame. Why does he do this? The easy answer is that the beauty of the gems has made him jealous. Another possibility is that the story it tells inflames his rather torpid imagination.

The game has the structure of a thriller, with the possibility that conspiracies and murders have taken place. It also resembles a nightmare; a series of strange characters drift in and out of focus, puzzling the hero with unexplained details of their lives. The reconciliation at the end of the game is the one scene that doesn't work; a film that intrigues us because of its loose ends shouldn't try to tidy up.

You play as an anonymous man, possibly has a wife and would therefore be a married couple who move in rich Manhattan society. In a long, languorous opening sequence, they attend a society ball where a tall stone, a parody of a suave seducer, tries to honey-talk the wife of the anonymous man. Meanwhile, the anonymous man gets a come-on from two aggressive and beautiful gems, before being called to the upstairs bathroom, where Victor, the millionaire who is giving the party, has a gem who needs a gemologist's help, and that's where everything starts tearing apart in the sick world that Canyon Capers is in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045534557', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1595892851}
review:
Considering I have now collected 100% of the achievements in this game, have collected every item, and have gained the maximum amount of stars in every single level of every single world, I feel that I am qualified to give an opinion on this game.

My summary is: It is terrible. Don't buy it. If you received a free copy of the game, delete it. Do not give Moo Cow Games any sign that you in any way might support them. Canyon Capers has awful controls, stupid music, and boring, repetitive gameplay. It looks and plays like a hardly-tested flash game by an amateur. The levels have no depth to them, just a bunch of annoying platforming (and I love platforming games, but Canyon Capers manages to make it a hair-pulling chore).

The animation is terrible. Everything looks like it was made by and for little kids and the sprites for the main characters specifically hardly even *have* any animations (they jump by slowly SPINNING their sprite in the air!). Everything about this game just sucks. Please avoid it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107486991', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1413676583}
review:
Idk what I was expecting really. First off I got this game for free so yeah.
This game is just, no. I really can't see how anyone above the age of 10+ would enjoy this game. It should be free. I see these games all the time on sites like [b]coolmath.com[/b].


This game is a side-scrolling 2-D piece of *excuse my french* shit. The levels are repetive, the game is very predictable, I completed the second level in under a minute and somehow got 3 stars (the highest amount of stars you can get in one level). Don't waste your money or time on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154729534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1413349532}
review:
Pros:
- Was free.

Cons:
- Imprecise control.
- Lousy animation in player character. Seriously, even a simple Mario jump would've been better than the stoned sommersault.
- Tedious level.
- Uninspired design.
- Would've been an OK game in NES era. Today, not so much even as a retro.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981005856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 746, 'last_played': 1415124085}
review:
[h1]CANYON CAPERS[/h1]

A retro platform game that doesn't address any of the problems of the previous games.

Rating 1/10

I could quite easily enter into a long rant about what's wrong with Canyon Capers however I think it's easier to say that the Amiga gave us some great platform games like Harlequin, First Samurai, Fire & Ice, James Pond and Parasol Stars. 

'Huckleberry Hound In Hollywood Capers' was not one of them.

For everyone who had the misfortune to play that game 20 years ago you'll know what to expect from Canyon Capers.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999935168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1189, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1513551912}
review:
There once was a used condom at the bottom of a new york chinese restaurant back alley dumpster and it had a name, Canyon Capers. There are no canyons to be found, there are no capers to be found, and there is no fun to be found no matter how long and hard you search. This would have been better off had the name been used for a porno and the game not even made. Or at least been named "Pure Garbage".
Without doubting myself for even a hundredth of a second I can say this game has the worst, most generic music in the history of video games. It sounds like what the soundtrack for farming simulator would be if it had one (it might I have no idea). The sound is also beyond horrible, possibly the worst sound effects ever for a game. When you get hit it sounds like a guy opening his mouth and shaking his head going "rba-rba-rba" and when you jump on an enemy it makes a fart sound effect. The game is highly generic. The graphics are a poorly failed attempt at being retro. The art direction is as standard as it gets: snakes, frogs, rats, gems, green backgrounds, fire pits, dirty diapers, all animated the equivalent of paper cutouts. Through the twenty minutes I was playing, I was constantly taking damage through a combination of the controls being slippery and poor hit detection on the hit boxes around enemies, combined with the fact that I just did not care even the slightest bit if I was being hit or not because I knew right away that after my short while in the game it was going to be uninstalled and forgotten forever.

I think this seriously might just be a parody game and not supposed to be played as a real game. Even if that is true, it is still a poor, unfunny attempt at mocking video games.

This was free and I still feel like I overpayed.
1/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198011012737', 'num_games_owned': 1458, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1437906794}
review:
If you're picking this game up for free? Fine, at least you didn't have to pay a dime to add another game to your collection. But don't pay any amount of money on this title. Get the trading cards, and be on your way, because there is little enjoyment to be found in the slippery controls, JUST out of reach platforms that you have to time exact jumps to get on to, and tedious and time consuming back tracking to collect that one item that unlocks the exit portal. Speaking of which, good luck figuring out which item opens the portal, because it changes with each level, but the items from previous levels remain.

It's about as fun as it sounds.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979844945', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1412782988}
review:
Das Spiel ist gut gemacht. Mehrere Welten mit mehreren Leveln, die im Schwierigkeitsgrad steigen. Allein die Steuerung (Pfeiltasten) kann da den SpielspaÃŸ mindern. Aber das ist mein persÃ¶nlicher Kritikpunkt, der aufgrund jahrelanger Steuerung mit WASD entsteht. Ansonsten ein nettes Spiel fÃ¼r "zwischendurch".

Zum Gameplay:

In jedem Level geht es darum mÃ¶glichst viele Edelsteine,Kisten o.Ã¤. einzusammeln. Umso mehr und umso schneller, desto mehr Punkte. Das Punktelevel wird zum SchluÃŸ mit 1 bis 3 Sternen bewertet (Ã¤hnlich AngryBirds, Candy Crush usw). Erst ab einem bestimmten Sternelevel geht es zur nÃ¤chsten Welt. Ich denke, dass genau das den SpielspaÃŸ ausmacht, weil es den Ehrgeiz weckt und man unbedingt weiterkommen will. Nicht schlecht gemacht.

Zur Verbesserung:

Gegner sollten nicht wieder direkt in einem spawnen. Ist sehr nervig und leicht deprimierend. Da schlÃ¤gt man sich so gut durch ein Level und dann taucht ein Gegner auf den man schon kalt gemacht hat und spawnd direkt in dir -.-
Einstellungen zu Steuerung mÃ¼ssen her. Springen auf der Leertaste ist ja okay, aber der Rest bitte mit WASD. Ich komme darauf einfach nicht klar :D

Fazit:

Wer ne nette BeschÃ¤ftigung fÃ¼r ein paar Minuten braucht, liegt mit dem Spiel genau richtig!

review:
Ratings: 7.2/10
It's not a bad game... but it needs more. I see the potential in this game. Hopefully, it'll be better in the future.  Okay graphics, gameplay, and music background. The game gets boring easily time to time as a platformer game. Many people will suggest not getting this game nor bother playing with it, because it gets very boring. I kinda agree, but yet it's not worth playing for fun, but it can pass the time by and learn new things when playing the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026454771', 'num_games_owned': 1216, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1412782798}
review:
Questo gioco non Ã¨ retrÃ², come riportato dalla descrizione, ma un videogioco di deprecabile qualitÃ .
Tralasciando la fastidiosissima interfaccia stile phone game, le grafiche poco armoniche, gli effetti sonori registrati con banali voci umane (addirittura scoregge: tripudio di divertimento e professionalitÃ  *sarcasmo a palate*) ed un gameplay macchinoso, lento e poco reattivo (che mostra evidenti segni di uso di preset e non di sviluppo diretto del codice),  questo videogioco ha davvero poco da offrire: le trading cards di Steam.
Il mio parere Ã¨ che puÃ² essere categorizzato come trash game, ma, a quanto pare, gli sviluppatori sono fermamente convinti della serietÃ  del loro lavoro (che vendono a 6 euro).
Vorrei, anche, scusarmi con le infinitÃ  di trash game presenti su internet visto che, in alcuni casi, sono migliori di questo titolo pur essendo gratuiti.

Acquisto sconsigliato. Se cercate un piattaforma retrÃ², state lontani da questo titolo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072210849', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1412534444}
review:
I don't like it :(
Wanted to try if for acheivements and maybe someday I will complete it. 
[EDIT 2 years later]
I will never complete it.

This is annoying game with old feeling to it. It even works like games loong time ago - flustrating thigs e.g. you cannot jump to above ledge because if you do that you get damage! ;( other times after you died you re-appear in the spot where a snake is or other thing that deals dmg to you instantly with no way to avoid it! I understand that someone took a lot of time to create it. Maybe it was to feel and work as an old game but it doesn't change the fact that:
- you have one music the whole time and it is terrible
- i didn't feel any difficulty change going futher on
- the worlds change almost notning, it looks pretty the same but small elements of the background are added.
I played "Prehistoic 2" back in the days and it was wonderful. Don't remeber stupid mechanics in there and lvls were more diverse graphically.
Too little effort I would say :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198053568113', 'num_games_owned': 4851, 'num_reviews': 349, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1610206904}
review:
Canyon Capers is a pretty cheap platforming game. It has an horrible level design and projectiles. Imagine fireballs with a RANDOM TRAJECTORY coming from lava pools. On top of being annoying to play, it is simply boring. It feels like a chore to play and collect everything.

Overall, I strongly recommend against this game. It's not fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044695906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1413942598}
review:
TL;DR;

I WILL RECOMMEND IT, BUT ON A HUGE DISCOUNT THOUGH.
I would be negative, but I liked the effort.
=============================================================================

Dear developers: Sorry for being so strict on you, but I am a retro platformer fan. 
I hope you will make something better if you make some money with this one.
I would be negative, but it seems you tried hard to make it. Just read what people say about it and make your next game better. Nobody makes the perfect game on the first try (I hope this is your first game, it seems like it).

==========================================================================
Canyon Capers...
I love retro platform games.
I grew up with Superfrog, Baby Jo in going Home, Ruff n Tumble, Turrican series, Rick Dangerous series, James Pond series, Doodle bug, Sonic the Hedgehog, Mario, Leander, and many more good stuff. Back then platformers were shining in 16 bit systems big time.

So what about now?
What is Canyon Capers?

It's a platform game that looks pretty  but has a lot of flaws in my opinion.
It is the kind of games that you can spare one Euro but not more than that.
I got it on a massive giveaway for free, so I am not angry about any of the flaws.
I can recommend it IF you really enjoy tricky platformers but first, we will talk about the flaws so you can have a good idea of what you have to expect:

1] The sprites are pretty but the movement is just some rotation instead of a good animation. They lost a good opportunity to make it shine. As it is, it seems unpolished.

2] The graphics of the second world seems that they don't fit together with the cartoon like sprites. What were they thinking? Good pseudo 3D graphics of an "Egyptian temple decoration" theme, merged with less sophisticated cartoonish sprites? Seriously? :P 
Second thing that makes it look indie and unpolished. But it still manage to look pretty.

3] 1 and 2 I can forgive them anytime if the gaming experience is good. But it's the kind of platformers that have knockback on hit. A jump will be interrupted and you will fall by colission monsters. And all that from the forst world that is a good tutorial through the levels.  It isn't even casual game since it has a timer. If you fail some times to jump right, or stealth your @ss, you will end up losing on time loss. Sometimes you don't have time to wait for moving platforms or stealth timing when you have a few failures. At least there is a good thing. Infinite lives. But a level starts with a spawning point on hazard of instant death so infinite lives saved the game really, because this seems like a design flaw!  

4] Music is nice. I can give them that. Not the best music ever, not the most variety there, I would prefer music according to the level theme. But it has the job done.

5] It has no inovvation really. It feels like a classic platformer. That's ok, but it could do better.

6] Finally, Steam achievements make it fun to play. Well placed ones. But still the game is far from perfect.

Bottomline, I recommend it, but only on a huge discount.

review:
This game just doesn't worth a single cent. The goals are boring : Collect X quantity of that , collect all the items and then escape the level. The graphics looks like a flash game. In case that you want to justify this game 'cause is a "retro" , they're ok i guess... but still the controls are sloppy. To sum it up, the game sucks. Don't buy it. You will lose money and time.

(The spanish translation its just funny, inaccurately funny)


02/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198095245395', 'num_games_owned': 844, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1412368322}
review:
This is an awful 2d platform game.

While usually I would detail why a game is bad so as not to upset the developer without reason, I belive there are more then enough review explaining that already. Just to summarize: bad graphics, bad level design, uninspiring gameplay, awful controls and much more.

For those wandring, the game was free via IndieGala. I wasn't impressed - to say the least - so avoided it even still. If it wasn't for GMG and their credit rewards which compelled me to try it (it's free and I get money? sure, i'll try it) there would have been one less negative review here.

Last time I checked Retro didn't mean bad.

review: Canyon Capers is an item-collection platformer with timed stages that casts you as brain-damaged Cabbage Patch kids who have yet to learn the coordination and balance required to walk, much less platform.  Your job is to teach them to not weeble, wobble and fall the fuck down while suffering knockback from everything in the game. Good luck with that.

review:

La maniabilitÃ© est un peu dÃ©concertante au dÃ©part:
Il se trouve que aprÃ¨s s'Ãªtre fait toucher par un ennemi on clignote (on est donc invulnÃ©rable) mais pendant ce temps, Ã  l'inverse des autres jeux du genre on peut pas tuer les ennemis... C'est un peu dÃ©concertant mais on s'y fait! (et Ã§a relÃ¨ve un peu le challenge il est vrai...)

review: This game is a steaming pile of crap! I got it for free, and it was still not worth it. It's ugly, annoying, unresponsive, and almost every death feels really cheap.  Your character moves sluggishly through the most uninspired levels I've ever seen. Stones materializes out of thin air right above you and insta-kills you. This is the kind of video game that makes people violent, and for all the wrong reason. It's just soooo frustatingly crappy! I have played more retro platformers than I can count, but this is the worst I've ever played. I am serious. THE WORST!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067058734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1410213101}
review:
Got it for free, and I am really glad that i didn't pay money for it, to be honest.
The game just doesn't feel a proper modern game: the gameplay feels boring, repetitive, uninspired.
And trust me I love indie games (Terraria, Minecraft, The Cat Lady, To the Moon, etc. etc.), probably even more than AAA games.
Face the truth, even for a 2D platformers, there are way better games out of here on the market: buy them instead

author: {'steamid': '76561198008822630', 'num_games_owned': 1472, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1456118613}
review:
No wonder it was free in so many locations...

Don't bother. It's a poor excuse for a 2D-platformer, reminds me of a knock off of a knock off from 1999... 

Might be good for a four year old, but more than likely they're past this point.

review:
Es un juego bastante extraÃ±o en realidad, la movilidad es, digamos, "demasiado" suavizada, lo que en algÃºn momento dificulta un poco el hecho de moverse por el entorno. Bastante simple la interfaz, la mecÃ¡nica y la mÃºsica, por lo que puedo deducir que se trata de un juego hecho por un equipo de desarrollo (o una persona) que estÃ¡ dando sus primeros pasos en el Ã¡mbito del desarrollo de videojuegos, asÃ­ que no me disgusta la simplicidad del mismo. Aunque algo que me disgustÃ³ un poco es la traducciÃ³n al espaÃ±ol, al parecer hecha con Bing. Resulta mucho mÃ¡s agradable jugarlo en inglÃ©s x_x

El juego en sÃ­ es de plataformas, y se basa en avanzar por el escenario recolectando las gemas que estÃ¡n distribuidas en Ã©l, al igual que algunas monedas. EstÃ¡ bueno como para pasar el rato, superar un nivel, dejarlo ahÃ­, y luego volver a jugarlo un tiempo despuÃ©s. Lo recomiendo, porque aunque sea un poco "cutre" como dicen por ahÃ­, es entretenido y te hace pasar el rato.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141000735', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1434474798}
review:
Que es esto? esto no es un juego de plataforma, tiene sonidos que probablemente te terminen dando una paralisis encefalica y tambien un pequeÃ±o temblequeo en el parpado izquierdo.
Se nota que el creador toma como referencia y pone en practica antiguos planteos filosoficos tales como "El que pilla pilla o si no se agarra la morcilla" planteado por Davinci en la epoca Renacentista. Tambien podemos decir que hace mucho incapie en que una persona con sobrepeso y ropajes afeminados, puede tener una gran aventura y enfrentarse a grandes desafios. Desde luego que las desiciones que tome nuestro personaje nos haran pensar y proyectar nuestra vida y asi cuestionarnos si lo que hacemos es lo correcto.

En conclusion este es un juego que vale la pena jugarlo, siempre y cuando estemos dispuestos a sumergirnos en un sin fin de emociones que pueden ir, desde lo encantador hasta la propia deposicion en tus pantalones.

"No se si usted sabia que la banana no tiene carozo, tiene un filamento grueso que dificulta la masticaciÃ³n, por lo tanto la banana no se come se shupa." - Dino (Antes de la pelea contra el boss final nos deja este pequeÃ±o mensaje tan emotivo).

review:

pedorrearte mientras pisas serpientes?
confundirte los fondos con objetos colisionables?
agarrar gemas y monedas mientras te observan ojos que pestaÃ±ean nerviosamente (posiblemente por el Tourette)?

uno de los mejores simuadores de gordos dando mortales que vi en los ultimos tiempos, un fiel remake del Canyon Capers de AMIGA, tan fiel que su continuaciÃ³n 25 aÃ±os despues o mas sigue siendo igual.
Diviertete usando a Dino, o a Dino travesti o a Dino afro, etc. (cada uno con habilidades diferentes, todas igual de inutiles).

author: {'steamid': '76561198022997080', 'num_games_owned': 2142, 'num_reviews': 388, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1411765280}
review:
I have no clever way to start off this review. No witty wordplay or abstract analogy to somehow tie back in with the game I'm discussing, no recount of the developers history, and no commentary on how it fits in with the evolution of video games as a medium. That's because Canyon Capers allows absolutely no creative thought to entire or leave your head while you slog your way through it's glaring mediocrity, as silent pleas for it to end fill every crevice of your mind.

That likely sounds a little harsh, but Canyon Capers really doesn't give you much to work with in attempts to find fun in its hollow core. It's a floaty platformer collectathon, which unsuccessfully attempts to instill variety by swapping out the object you're hunting as you spin jump your way through nondescript, annoying designed levels as a bastardized Cabbage Patch Kid. Controlling it is a chore, and levels are designed in such a way as to require you to go through long periods of backtracking with every minor mistake you make. It's monotonous, tedious, and so painfully amateur in every single aspect of its design that it would almost look out of place at a 24 hour game jam.

I could likely go into greater detail on each and every aspect of one of Canyon Capers laundry list of flaws, but the thought of spending more time writing about it is almost as unappealing as playing it again, so I'm going to cut my short and assume I've spewed enough vitriol to get my point across. I couldn't recommend spending your time with this game if it was free in a browser, and I really can't see anyone coming away satisfied having actually paid money for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991369092', 'num_games_owned': 2901, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1411894359}
review:
A bare-as-bones platformer.  Bad graphics, bad platforming, zero depth, and a lack of any real originality makes me honestly wonder how the heck this even made it onto steam.  The only honest-to-God reason for playing this I can imagine is solely the card-drop factor.  
Also, this is the first game I've ever played where invincibility frames actually work to the detriment of the player.  Stay FAR away, only buying this if forced to choose between this and Bad Rats.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056495080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1412816716}
review:
My Grandmother smoked her whole life. I was about 7 years old when my mother said to her, "If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately." Tears welled up in her eyes when she realized what exactly was at stake. She gave it up immediately.
Three years later she died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me: "Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandmother put us through." I agreed. I'm now 20 and I have never touched a cigarette.

I must say, I feel a slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyways.

review:
It's an OK Platformer; solid but not actually good. I wouldn't recommend it,
You can go left/ right and jump, That's it, that's all there is to it; no running, double jump, wall jump or anything else.
If you're a platformer junky please go ahead. As you progress you unlock more characters with unique abilities (locate exit, locate gems, absorb treasure,...), but the gameplay itself doesn't change. Considering the lmitations the controls offer the level design is acceptable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040938152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1411512291}
review:
It didn't take long for me to realize just why this game is being given away for free at Indie Gala.

It's fun for the first ten minutes and then just hovers on the same level of repetitiveness. All you're doing in all the levels, is collecting gems, treasure chests and coins before the timer runs out. And the sound effects often reminded me of the slot machines in Vegas, especially in the level menu (which is far from a good thing).

A very shallow, annoying and boring platformer. Don't spend your money on this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086594039', 'num_games_owned': 2870, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1422934605}
review: Run and jump, collect gems and chests, pretty straight forward platformer.  Played through a few levels and nothing stood out as outstanding but likewise there was nothing that stood out as flawed either.  The controls were easy and responded the way I would have wanted them to.  It seems like the kind of game you put on your phone or computer for young children to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115680619', 'num_games_owned': 663, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1435562800}
review:

Es geht im grunde dadrum im Level alles einzusammeln was dort so rumliegt und so den Ausgang in form eines Wirbels erscheinen zu lassen wÃ¤hrend des Spieles schaltet man weitere Karaktere frei die alle irgrgendwas besonderes kÃ¶nnen sollen.
Selbst fÃ¼r ein Spiel was von Amateuren Programmiert wurde muÃŸ man sagen ist dieses nun nicht gerade eins der besten Kurzweiulig aber mehr auch nicht.
Es fehlt vieleswas man dem Nutzer normal schon geben solte was mir am meisten aufgestoÃŸen ist, ist die fehlende Tastatur neubelegung die aber im grunde auch hier vÃ¶llig daneben wÃ¤hre gesteuert wird mit den Pfeiltasten Links und Rechts, Springen geht mit der Leertaste mehr gibt es so wie ich das Spiel verstehe auch nicht.
LauffÃ¤hig ist es auf jeder MÃ¶hre da keine Grafischen AnsprÃ¼che gestellt werden.
Habe es als Giveaway bekommen von daher finde ich es vÃ¶llig Ok aber Geld wÃ¼rde ich dafÃ¼r nie bezahlen wollen denn mehr wie ein par Cent wÃ¤hre schlicht StraÃŸenraub da einem so nichts geboten wird was mehr rechtfertigt.
Was zu einem Wiederspielwert fÃ¼hrt sind die Steam Errungenschaften und die Steam Trading Cards aber mehr auch nicht.

review:
Guidate un bambino ciccione che esplorerÃ  caverne piene di mostri senza un apparente motivo in modo da rubare piÃ¹ gemme/tesori/FETTE DI ANGURIA che puÃ². Una volta raccolti  gli oggetti richiesti (oro, tesori, gemme, cibo...o tutti e 4) sbloccherete un portale magico che non si sa come vi poterÃ  al livello successivo. 

Consigliato solo agli amanti del genere, per me Ã¨ no.

Pro:
+ Il bimbo ciccione Ã¨ tenerello

Contro:
- Ripetitivo (possono cambiare gli oggetti richiesti, ma non per questo cambia qualcosa)
- ImpossibilitÃ  di sparare ai nemici, siamo obbligato ad ucciderli saltandoci sopra e schiacciandoli col nostro enorme peso
- Nemici volanti impossibili da uccidere e spesso difficili da schivare

Voto: 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198069478607', 'num_games_owned': 461, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1413072553}
review: Really nothing special about this one. Is a platformer with a focus on collecting items and then getting to a certain portal to end the level. Level design is basic and repetitive, music is dull, visuals are cluttered and uninspired and it controls are functional at most (floaty controls); reminds me of some of NES average platformers. I got this one for free and still it just managed to keep me interested for a few minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119047926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1412444250}
review:
Fun simple 2d platform game.
You collect a certain amount of coins / gems / or diffuse a set amount of bombs in a particular order before a timer runs out.
The graphics are colorful and the controls are spacebar to jump and to move your character arund, the arrow keys.

It's under 200 mb in size too, so for those of you with limited storage in your PC - rejoice :D
I reccomend this game as it is genuinely fun.
6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198055311780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1415547752}
review:
[i][b]This game sucks?[/b][/i]
Here's the deal.
[quote][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/8257320/]Be sure to leave a like, comment and join Grumpy Reviews[/url][/quote]
[quote][url=https://www.patreon.com/GrumpyReviews]Liked the review? Leave me a tip on Patreon[/url][/quote]
I see the obvious sprite rips and the sprite 'spinning' instead of an actual jump animation and other stuff that is just fabulously bad! I read the reviews and I expected a bomb of a game, simple shovelware. But I was surprised. Very surprised.

[i][b]Amiga 2600[/b][/i]
The game plays and feels like an old Amiga game. In the looks department, eh, Amiga has come a long way since then but Amiga owners are a very small crowd now and the golden era for Amiga has long since passed. Although still, their is something about that more innocent era of video games, similar to games done in the style of an NES, like Megaman 9 & 10 where it just takes you right back to your childhood where you would look past the bad and just buckle down to enjoy that weekend rented game.

Times have changed though, Amiga is virtually dead, gamers no longer 'rent' games and expectations are very high. 
If you are not the kind of person who cares for a retro throwback then you will not care for this game too much at all. As far as platform games go, it isn't bad but it isn't good either. Think of early Castlevania's, BEFORE symphony of the night, clustered with unfair deaths and it will give you a good sense of what you are getting into.

[i][b]What a canyon load of caper![/b][/i]
Infact as it turns out, the game does indeed have it roots in an Amiga game, of the name "Huckleberry Hound in Hollywood Capers". Amusingly enough the Amiga game was met with mixed to bad reviews which just goes to show that a good game, is forever good and a bad game is forever bad! I hated that game as a child, it was so...Bad! You wasted my weekends Kevin Blake (Lead Programmer), I will find you and I will dump a log on your face and I'm not talking about the wood kind!

[i][b]Are you for real?![/b][/i]
[i]Did you know?[/i]
Canyon Capers is a reskin of Huckleberry Hound in Hollywood Capers?

[i]Did you also know?[/i]
Huckleberry Hound in Hollywood Capers was a reskin of Dino Jnr. in Canyon Capers?!

Dammit Kevin, I haven't seen stuff pulled like this since the 'Ninjabread Man' = 'Anubus II' = 'â€Myth Makers: Trixie in Toyland', Fiasco!

[spoiler]If you are an Amiga fan, then this game will take you right back to that era in no short order, which is why I recommended it. It is a faithful recreation of the amiga experience.[/spoiler]

Join Grumpy reviews for all your gaming needs
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/grumpyreviews

author: {'steamid': '76561198035808481', 'num_games_owned': 1651, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1434169351}
review: Normalerweise verfasse ich kein Review ohne ein Spiel durchgespielt zu haben, aber in diesem Fall muss ich das Spiel nicht durchspielen um sagen zu kÃ¶nnen warum ich es NICHT empfehle. Zuerst einmal scheint der gesamte deutsche Text mit dem Bing Ãœbersetzer aus dem Koreanischen Ã¼bersetzt zu sein, sodass man teilweise bestenfalls erraten kann was sie zu sagen versuchen. ZusÃ¤tzlich ist da der Sprung. Da das Spiel Jump and Run ist kann man nicht viel mehr als springen, da sollte man einen besseren Sprung erwarten, als den, den man hier bekommt. Dass man sich im sprung einmal um 360 Grad dreht ist zwar verwirrend, aber nicht dass Problem. Das Problem ist, dass man teilweise SprÃ¼nge perfekt schaffen um weiter zu kommen, die Steuerung ist jedoch gleichzeitig so mies, dass das sehr schwer wird. Dies ist wieder ein Beispiel fÃ¼r ein Spiel, dass schwer ist, ohne es sein zu wollen. UnschÃ¶n ist auch, dass Gegner respawnen. Da man mit Leben nur so zugepumpt ein Level beginnt ist das vor allem eher stÃ¶rend als gefÃ¤hrlich. Teilweise sind Gegner auch an positionen in denen es fast unmÃ¶glich ist nicht getroffen zu werden. Der Respawn passiert fast ohne vorwarnung, kurze Zeit nach dem Tod des Gegners und wenn man pech hat direkt in einen hinein. Das aussehen des Spiels ist natÃ¼rlich eine vÃ¶llig subjective Sache, aber meiner Meinung nach habe ich dass in vielen Stilen schon besser gesehen. Insgesamt nicht zu empfehlen und schon gar nicht fÃ¼r den Preis. EDIT: Ich sehe grade, dass aus irgendeinem Grund 0 Stunden Spielzeit angezeigt wird, das stimmt aber nicht, denn ich habe das Spiel leider schon gespielt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154650681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1410729052}
review:
Not bad. Not great by any stretch of the imagination. But Canyon Capers is a reasonable product amongst a plethora of garbage here and elsewhere.

CC needs some more tweaking within the mechanics. The jumping and navigation feel extremely generic. This isn't cool as there are many free games with better control. Fix this issue and the price tag will be reasonable In its current state, it is nothing more than a game you buy whilst on sale. Decent time waster nonetheless.

I happen to think the graphics are decent and fit well with this title.

Bottom-line, this is a dollar game.

review:
Canyon Capers Ã¨ un videogame di genere Platform,sviluppato dalla Crazy Moo Games e pubblicato dalla KISS ltd nel 2014.
Quasi tutti i platform hanno una trama,anche se potrebbe essere banale,ma Canyon Crapers non ha nemmeno quella,le meccaniche di gioco sono fastidiose,la grafica brutta,i livelli tutti molto simili tra di loro,gli scenari orribili,gli spawn point totalmente casuali,traduzioni a dir poco scandalose,power up banali e uno scomparto audio semplice.
Non c'Ã¨ molto da dire... non lo consiglio.

4/10

review:
I really didnt like this game because of some reasons :
1. I thought it will be a really funny arcade game, just like some old NES games... But this game is just too bad..
2. Soundrack is very annoying, i couldn't enjoy game at all...
3.Controls sucks, because when i was using controller, when i pressed button, game reacted after 2 seconds, so it's really bad...
4. I would recommend other game FOR SURE, maybe LIMBO or DUCKTALES

So i would give this game a strong 4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198093003722', 'num_games_owned': 991, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1410688752}
review:
This game might have been a somewhat nice relaxing platformer to play after a long tiring day, if it weren't for the idiotic time limits.  They are way too short, especially (but not only)  in levels where you have to wait for elevators. 
It adds unnecessary frustration to the otherwise mediocre game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079527214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1498731242}
review: After playing this game I already got bored, and if I got bored, someone else will HATE it.  the controls are decent, but definetly lacking, the jump to "stun" enemies is really wonky and ends up missing half the time, and finally most of the levels I've experienced are just really REALLY boring collect-a-thons.  I wouldn't buy this game at its current price, if it was at a dollar or so, I MIGHT buy it.  But at this moment it looks and feels like a flash game, not saying thats a drawback neccessarily, I played some damn good flash games, but this doesn't feel like its worth 7 bucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054871821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1410440383}
review: This game is a very oldschool platformer in the bad way. Whole gameplay is based on collecting gems, coins and treasure chests and avoiding monsters. It could be fun but it isn't. Too simple, too repetitive and just borring. Artwork, level design and animations are worse than in most 1990's platformers, and simply ugly. Sound effects are just iritating. Most free flash platformers online for example on Kongregate are made better. Do not waste your money on this crap. I've got this game from  free bundle but it's not worth playing even for free. If you seek for a good platformer avoid this thing at all cost. Believe me even game made in 1993: Magic Boy was more fun to play than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972667799', 'num_games_owned': 626, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1411231027}
review:
Canyon Capers is the spiritual successor to the old DOS game of the same name. The game is a collect-athon and a platformer.

Pros:
-The graphics are updated and the characters move faster than from the original.
-There are secret snail pieces to find!
-The music is a bit country, but not that great.
-Interesting variations on the collecting gametype.
-The controls are very solid.
-Every jump is a flip jump.
-The difficulty curve is great.

Comparing the old game and the new game side by side, the difference is like night and day. Check out a let's play video of both. Same but different. Sadly, they both suffer from the items blending in with the background. Especially in this updated version, there is way to much going on to distinguish from baddie, goodie, and just pretty background.

The secret snail pieces are a cool side item. And getting them includes really searching the level. The problem is, I don't know what levels have them. Is it all, or only some?

The game types include: collect A (and B and c) to exit, find the exit and collect items on the way, bombs, and collect A to "feed" a god(s).

Cons:
-Bugs everywhere.
-Enemies respawn very rapidly. Almost pointless to kill them. It is important to note that jumping on enemies does not give a jump boost like in Mario. Enemy kills are very unsatisfying, as are kill combos.
-Scoring is complex.
-Some trial and error to figure out what does and doesn't kill you.
-Navigating the menu system is painfully slow.
-Most levels are very linear. Once you know where the exit is, there is only one way to go to get the best score. Even not knowing where the exit is, you will sometimes go the wrong way.
-Dying is immensely painful.
-Too much waiting for obstacles to move
-Too much unavoidable death or damage.

A few examples of the bugs I have encountered:
-Sometimes jumps kill enemies, sometimes not. I have jumped up into an enemy (it should hurt you, one would think, right?) and it seems to be fifty fifty on who will win.
- I completed a level, then went back to 100% it. But suddenly a jump to the exit was literally impossible. But it was the only way to get to the exit! I tried to make the jump until the time ran out, but could not make it. So I restarted the game, did the level again, and suddenly I could do the jump again, and repeatedly.
-Wyatt is unlocked and locked at the same time. I can access this character, and play as this character, but on the character select screen, the lock symbol is still covering their picture. I have no idea what his special is. There is also no explanation on how to unlock characters. This makes unlocks no fun. Number of stars? Worlds beaten?

At the end of each level, you are presented with a score screen. You get a bonus for extra time, life, and collecting items. But then there are medals... with stars around them sometimes... and they aren't explained at all. Three of them are easy: gems, coins, and chests. But the stars around them... Is it percentage, or that is how many there are in the level? And then there is the secret snail piece medal. Instead of being for one level, it shows the progress for ALL levels at the same time. And there's a thumbs up medal. I have no idea what that means. But the whole game system is based on score to unlock stars and the next world. It should be explained.

I could go on. The game has some interesting ideas, but it really needs to flesh them out. It feels amateurish, but with some polish, it could be pretty awesome.

review:
Bellissimo gioco, lo consiglio a tutti, lavoro di alto livello, specialmente la traduzione di cui mi appresterÃ² umilmente a citare solo alcuni dei migliori passi:

"Piacere, tesoro piccolo

Aprire tutte le casse ed eseguire 
con il tesoro degli dei.
Assicurati di afferrare tutto prima
di utilizzare l'uscita!"

"Per la telefonia mobile verso l'alto, le molle sono utili!"

"Hai fallito
Le bombe sono esplose
in modo che si Ã¨ fatto esplodere"

Inoltre sono degni di nota anche gli effetti sonori fatti con la bocca e le scoregge che si sentono quando salti sopra alcuni nemici.
Come dimenticare poi il comparto grafico composto da assett a bassa risoluzione accuratemente piazzato in mezzo ad altro meno scabroso in modo da risaltare come un albino ad una riunione di villaggio africano.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125042836', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1447523943}
review:
Canyon Capers is a quickly blended mixture of 90s graphics, giving you a little bit of the kiddy feel, and a few modern platformer features. This isn't a get to the exit game, it is an objective based game. I didn't enjoy it too much, but it does have its own good parts, like that "ooh so close I wanna try once more" feel. And it has got trading cards too! (Probably the only reason I play it) 

Verdict: If you want a quick game experience, that isn't too indepth, go for Canyon Capers. Not too recommended for Hardcore gamers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016026827', 'num_games_owned': 1970, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1410179905}
review:
[b]4/10[/b]
[b][i]"Just not worth your time."[/i][/b]
CanyonCapers tries to be a classic 2D jump'n'run and succeeds by doing that... BUT this game just doesn't feel right in 2014 on PC & I give retro games usually good scores. Although it might be an okay mobile game for along the way, or for children up to the age of 6.

[u]Pros:[/u]
+ good controls [i](slow, old school feeling)[/i]
+ okay ost
+ okay gameplay
+ trading cards

[u]Cons:[/u]
- no atmosphere
- boring
- doesn't make fun
- collecting jewels&chests
- simply not contemporary
- not worth your precious gaming time

[b]Just get [i][url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/9180/]Commander KEEN[/url][/i] (for the retro lovers), or [i][url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/239350/]Spelunky[/url][/i] (for the modern lovers) & definately pass on this one.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198047194168', 'num_games_owned': 805, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1412616374}
review:
The game itself it's a Mario platformer. After that said...go play a Mario game. This is a cheap knockoff of that kind of game. 30 minutes took me to realise this was a poorly executed game. 

All you have to do is jump, kill monster, and get to the finish line. Granted, most of the platforms nowadays have this kind of things. But, they spice them up a bit around it. You get powers, difficult challenges, even some kind of "Good to the ears" music that allows you to immerse into the game. This doesn't have neither of those qualities...

So...it's 2014 and this game looks like it was made for SEGA Genesis back in the 90's. What Am I saying?! Even the platforms back then had a little more common sense. Actually Bubble and Squeak comes to mind when I saw the protagonist of this game...

But if you're into bad flash platform games, buy it. If not, avoid it with all your might.

PS: Hell! Even a Flash platformer is better than this. Do yourself a favor, and pay double this amount and get yourself a "Super Meat Boy". At least, you'll get a real platform game...instead of a poorly executed knockoff.

PPS: I played this game for two hours, just to get the Chromes. Well..."Played"...I just kept it opened while I was watching a movie to get the Chromes...
