author: {'steamid': '76561198095103067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1410096685}
review:
It's like Super Mario.
But with a buggy menu that likes to crash, and cause you to have to slam alt+F4 until eerything eventually closes on your computer (Because Ctrl Alt Delete doesn't work)
And also horrible movement that feels like you're sliding.
And stupid flippy jumping animations to mask the fact that you can't actually jump.
And poorly made sprites that don't match up properly.
And the timer is a bar at the bottom of the screen, instead of a number at the top.

In short: You're better off buying Super Mario.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133146205', 'num_games_owned': 1223, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1426900721}
review: Its dated art style definitely put even me off quite a bit and its mechanics are solid and well designed but perhaps a bit too simple and locked into the history of its name. That said, underneath its unimpressive exterior is a decent platformer that offers up a reasonably meaty experience and no doubt a nostalgia trip for players who grew up on DOS and Amiga games.

review:
Un completo caos de plataformas. El diseÃ±o causa daÃ±o a la vista, y la forma en la que todo, plataformas, enemigos, fosos y tesoros, estÃ¡ esparcido por cualquier parte, lo convierte en un fallo total de juego.

No sÃ© quÃ© decir positivo sobre este juego. El regustillo a plataformas clÃ¡sico de Amiga estÃ¡ ahÃ­, pero de clÃ¡sico de "viejo", no clÃ¡sico en plan "bueno, memorable".

author: {'steamid': '76561198119722324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1449470191}
review:
El juego es un plataformero comun y corriente, con tiempo. No me gusto el que las detecciones de colisiones entre sprites fallan, entonces a veces estas seguro de haber matado un enemigo al caerle encima, pero en lugar de ello te hacen daÃ±o y sales empujado a un costado. Por otro lado se supone que el respawneo de enemigos debiera ocurrir despues de la animacion de respawneo, pero si por mala suerte tocas un enemigo antes que reaparezca resultas daÃ±ado.
No tiene tantos problemas pero te los topas muy frecuentemente, asi que te vas frustrando cada vez mas.
Tambien hay un problema con las instrucciones del juego y sus traducciones al espaÃ±ol, podrian haberle pagado a alguien para que hiciera textos decentes

author: {'steamid': '76561198117295623', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1410067279}
review:
I'm a fan of this game, I really am. I enjoy it, it brings me back to the old PS1 games.

BUTTTTTTTTT, the controls are really clunky. And most the time the hit boxes are bad.

So, here are the pros and cons.

Pros:
Nostaligic feel
Enjoyable playstyle

Cons:
Clunky controls
Bad hitboxes
Awful platforming sometimes
Unfair timer.

I will probably complete this game just for the satisfaction of completing it. I will update this if needed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094770853', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1410496556}
review:
Sorry but can't recommend it :(
There are few reasons for it:
1: System requirements - I don't know does this game can't run on lower but it's quality is not even near something you can play on this machine. Compared to other games with similar requirements it is not realy that good.
2: Resolution - People don't use same screen resolution and this is locked and people haveing other resolution see game dissorted which is not nice.
3: Physics - It's not bad just i don't like it. Things like not being able to jump off creatures or when you jump on two creatures at same time you kill one and another one kills you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968587121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1409888484}
review:
I got this game as part of a free giveway from Indiegala, so in that perspective there wasn't much to lose here. But even still it's hard to believe that this game made it past 'Greenlight'.  It's practically a poor man's flash game platformer, similar to the really bad titles you would see on the Xbox Live Indie Marketplace (not saying all of them are bad, but a fair chunk of them are).

First off, the graphics look cheap, and I mean REALLY cheap.  I'm just not a fan of the overly pixelated style graphics in general, but this makes that style look like a masterpiece in comparison. The backgrounds also have barely any life to them, with maybe one or two blinking eyes in a dark area or what-not and that's about it (At least that's how far I made it into the game, but I'll get to that part soon).

The sound effects are inappropriately used, whenever you jump on an enemy, a 'farting' noise is made. This sound is used over and over again and you'll soon be wanting to get through the game without going anywhere near the enemies at all. And that's another thing, getting actually 'hit' by the enemies does take your life away, but even when you die it doesn't matter. You just respawn in EXACTLY the same place you were before. So the illusion of 'game over' is completely gone.

There's also a time limit in each level, so you have to get the set amount of items and get to the exit portal before it runs out. Nuff' said.

Overall, this game is a heck of a chore to get through, and if you must try it out, go to Indiegala and get it for free. Even paying for this game at a 75% discount is not worth it.

-GabrielKnightStorm

author: {'steamid': '76561198055879492', 'num_games_owned': 1288, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1409882504}

author: {'steamid': '76561198059971262', 'num_games_owned': 2460, 'num_reviews': 632, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1573028117}
review:
This game is frustrating. Not in a good way though. 
Every levels feels like the same, Sound effects feels out of place, the different characters doesn't do much except change the aesthetic, and the whole game reeks of really bad level design. The only difference between so many levels are, one you collect coins, one you collect gems, and one you collect treasures. Some level have a combination of them, but seriously -- what's the point of making some different things to collect if they're pretty much the same? It doesn't add variety, it makes the game feel even more bad and amateur-ish. 

In one level, which was one of the first in the second world (Level 11, then) one freaking flying ennemy kept hitting me every single time I was going to do a jump to reach the final treasure; only to be hit by the flying ennemy WHO ALSO CHARGES AT YOU, Result, I miss my jump, I have to go ALL THE WAY FROM THE BEGINNING, only to miss the jump again.
There were like 3 seconds left after I finally finished the level, and I got 3 stars. I could have finished it with a minute left, but I still had an high score for the level!?

I really feel like nobody test those levels, they are really boring, frustrating jumps, bad item placement, oddly-placed ennemies. Seriously, some ennemies are on some unreachable place of the level, which makes you think you can go there at first, but then you realize they were too lazy to put something to make you understand that you can't go there.

There's those bombs levels, they are really bland and boring. They don't even look like bombs, and most of the time you miss your jump, the bomb supposedly explodes, and you go back to the level select screen. Once you get rid of one, you need to search the whole level for the next one, since there's a particular order. most of the time, the next bomb is the one WHO IS RIGHT NEXT TO THE OTHER; it feels like they wanted to put more "bombs" than the level could, so they set up some bombs right next to the other. It feels like some really lazy level design. 

There's those freaking tunnels in this game, where sometimes ennemies go throught, and if you don't want to get hurt, you need to wait since there's no way to not get it by an ennemy in one of them. Ugh.

One of the thing I hate the most in this game, it's those big boulder who kill you one hit. IN those levels with boulders, they spawn randomly, and it's really hard to not get hit. It frustrates me way too much.

The whole life counter looks good, but I'm unable to know if I can or can't get hit again. It's one big heart who minimize every time I get it, except it doesn't seems to be smaller at first.

If it's supposed to be a "retro platformer", why can you get hit something like 10 times before dying and respawning somewhere defined in the game?

don't get me "jumped" about those jumps in this game. They are horrible.

TL;DR, stay away from this game. Don't even buy it, it doesn't even worth it. I got it free, and I feel stolen when I think about this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082089538', 'num_games_owned': 784, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1409880561}
review:
Sorry I just couldn't get into the game. I'm not complaining considering i got a key for this game, however this game feels as if i can play this for free off of some website or something. 

Basically you play as some guy who collects crap. You can do other things and stuff like jump on springs and squish enemies, but the core is collecting the gems and opening the chests (walking over them), which neither feels rewarding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072577321', 'num_games_owned': 1038, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1409877354}
review:
Aunque suene racista, este juego esta basado en un boliviano saltarin que agarra monedas, frutas y bombas.

No es recomendado comprar este juego, si no queres gastar plata al pedo, porque la verdad que este juego es lo mas malo de Steam a mi parecer! xD
Ademas de que es frustrante jugar algunos niveles.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970791901', 'num_games_owned': 4017, 'num_reviews': 413, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1409919994}
review:
E' talmente brutto che sto soffrendo anche nel giocare soltanto per ottenere le carte.
Si tratta, in poche parole, di un platform 2D in cui il nostro scopo Ã¨ semplicemente prendere gemme di tre colori, in livelli via via piÃ¹ difficili.
A volte, tanto per variare (wow), le gemme colorate sono sostituite da forzieri del tesoro. wow.

Ci si muove con le freccette direzionali. si salta con spazio.
Musica fastidiosa ed irritante.
Tutto condito da un senso di infantilismo quasi fastidioso, e demente.


Ovviamente l'ho avuto gratis. E mi sento comunque derubato. Del mio tempo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005824158', 'num_games_owned': 527, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1410016429}
review:
It haves good spirit and seems that the developers had fun with it, though it haves too many flaws to let pass, I know this is supposed to be an amiga sort of "game-play" but if you are doing something like this try modernizing it to the era, back then level design was a mess because designers where still new to the videogame concept, but now we got many examples of great platforming. The game haves ok controls, tiring music since there is like only 1 track, okay-ish art (except for the stock pictures) horrible translations and even bad grammar on its own language, and bad level design, and this last one is the one that strikes the hardest, because this is the sole reason I dont reccoment it, it gets frustatingly hard vary fast. I actually was having fun for the first few levels but then there where this tricky jumps and overall bad design on the levels that threw me off at around level 6 I think.

I donÂ´t mean the game is terrible, there was definetly some effort put into it, its just something I wouldnt go out recommending to my friends or people who haves little kids, because there are definetly better games out there even for the young ones (which my guest is where the target audience).

author: {'steamid': '76561197998161820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1413731171}
review:
I'm going to start out by saying everything in this game works fine as far as mechanics, save for a few bad hit detection issues when jumping on enemies. Jumping on enemies in this game is unneccesary though, as you can just avoid them for the most part. Here's my issue: although mechanically sound, this is possibly the most boring and generic platformer I have played. 

For example, in a level you will need to collect all the diamonds. So you collect all the diamonds which opens an exit portal and you go through to end the level. Now the next level you need to collect all the treasure chests and go through the exit portal to end the level. Finally, in some levels, you need to collect all the coins, diamonds, and treasure chests to exit the level. It's all the same. There's no difference in what you're collecting or doing really besides the items looking different. The only levels that have a different theme seem to be ones where you need to collect lit bombs in a certain amount of time before they explode, but still, it's just collecting with a shorter time limit tacked on.

The levels here are, in my opinion, forgettable. The graphics are decent, but do I ever want to replay a level because it was fun? No, not really. The incentive seems to be to get a better rating in each level. This is difficult for me because I do enjoy trying to get the best rating I can in each level in most games. This game doesn't entice me in the least to do so. 

The reward for getting a good rating in each level is working toward unlocking extra characters. Each character has a slightly different mechanic they bring to the table, but the original character will point you toward the exit gate, which can be a pain to find in larger levels so I stick with the default anyway.

If you can get this in a bundle with a few other games you want, that's fine. Then you can try it out on the cheap. I would not recommend paying full price here for what you are getting. It's marketed as a nostalgic platformer with updated graphics, but there needed to be something different here to make it worth buying. This type of game has been done to death and people have moved on because of new and innovative ideas in the platforming genre. There is nothing new here, no reason to keep playing past the first couple levels, as all this game has to offer is shown to you early on and builds toward nothing.

For number rating people, 5/10- It's a mostly mechanically sound collectathon that isn't all that fun. You're not missing out if you never play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996501124', 'num_games_owned': 7813, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1437043761}
review:
Canyon Capers is an old school collect-a-thon platformer with a crazy sensibility. The sound effects and graphics are off the wall, but the gameplay is sold, and well worth the reasonable asking price. The Soccer-based DLC is a nice spin on the basic gameplay, and brings good variety.

Want more info? Check out my Bundle Buys video about the game! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w_L7IX9om4Y&list=UU1hXAHxQhZUS0XgzCZsZvwA

author: {'steamid': '76561198013213702', 'num_games_owned': 9274, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1407111361}
review:
This game is... It's not good. 

The controls are tolerable, but not super precise, they should be better considering this is a platformer. 

The *art* is super low effort. 

The sound effects are out-of-place and nonsensical. 

The interface isn't great. 

But, it's still better than Dead Bits. 

So it's got that going for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012654954', 'num_games_owned': 2794, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1406369784}
review:
As soon as I launched this game, it looked rather promising. I had absolutely no clue what it was about, or anything like that, but I played it, because, hey. I was given it, and it has cards.

The premise of this game is some form of really poorly made platformer. The art isn't bad, but the actual physics, and animation is where the game falters, as well as the controls.

The jumping feels sluggish, and bland, and the animations just don't look good. This game tries to be Super Mario without the huge jumps, or the powerups, and it fails badly at it.

The menus are borderline horrific, as I spent a while just bashing buttons trying to find out how to actually start this horrific venture into the world of poorly made indie platformers, and the controls also took me a while to figure out, because apparently, WASD isn't cool anymore, and, to my knowledge, we can't even change the controls.

In short, this game is horrible, gives me headaches, and you're better off just playing Super Mario, or something more well made that doesn't crash every five seconds, and leave the process running. But what am I complaining. I get cards.

10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009662092', 'num_games_owned': 3450, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1405320042}
review: A variety of challenges and comptent mechanics make this a suprisngly enjoyable platformer.  The developers prove their competency at level design, even if the overal presentation of the game is thinly glued together in a mobile port format that underserves the rest of the games content.  They're also very proactive about support and the game is reasonably priced.  Consider buying it.

review: I picked this up on a Steam sale and am glad that I did. Canyon Capers is a fun side scroll game. I suggest using a game controller unless you have great reflexes (I don't). The graphics are really good, gameplay is solid. Fun to play. Highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991209263', 'num_games_owned': 669, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1403640978}
review:
I'm not a really a fan of platform games, but thought for the price this would be worth a shot - if only for the nippers. Turns out it is quite good fun and I ended up playing it a chunk myself. 
It works well with the keyboard or a 360 controller and is responsive and accurate with either. It plays nice and smooth too.
The graphics have a retro style/feel but without resorting to the usual blocky style many retro style games have.
Finally the difficulty curve seems pretty much just right. Quite simple to learn but getting more difficult as the levels progress giving you that 'just one more go' appeal.  End of level score is based on how much you collected and you are also awarded stars - so theres a replay factor there too in returning to collect any missing stars.
The sound is the only real area thats a letdown. The music isnt especially bad and fits in well but starts to get quite repetitive and there seems to be very little in the way of different sound effects. 
Overall I can highly recommend Canyon Capers, its not going to be the next COD or GTA - but in terms of value and fun its great !

author: {'steamid': '76561198023788861', 'num_games_owned': 2550, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1403315174}
review:
In my opinion, not a good title.

A commom platform, with no twist at all. Jump-and-collect mechanic, plain and simple. You already played something like this somewhere else, you can find better and enhaced 2d-platforms experiences today. Enemys are dull. Music is also a downer, kinda repetitive. 

Positive is the background art, loved it. Not enough to hold up a game, though

author: {'steamid': '76561197981851735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1403066393}
review:
DO NOT BUY. This is an old-ass game with very few changes  to the original idea and a half hearted facelift of the original graphics. I, and possibly others, have been banned from this game's steam forums for even bringing attention to the fact this game had a life 20 years ago.

Proof: http://youtu.be/WQwZl6MJGBI

"Trolling", or daring to have good taste and ethics?

author: {'steamid': '76561198033941177', 'num_games_owned': 1049, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1403038220}
review:
I found this game to  be exceedingly frustrating when using the keyboard.  It may be better with a controller and I'll try that later, but I can't recommend it on the keyboard.  It felt sloppy and hard to control.  The time limits were annoying more than challenging, and the collection of stuff just felt tedious rather than fun.

The world cup DLC is cute, but also frustrating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001531560', 'num_games_owned': 5779, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1419258422}
review:
As a platformer this game leaves a lot to be desired. The controls are somewhat sloppy, the level design is uninspired, and there is no goal other than collect X objects and exit the level.

On the plus side the music and visuals are decent.

This game feels like a quick port of a mediocre mobile game. I was suckered in by its charming retro asthetics but was bored after only 3 levels.  Not worth a purchase in my opinion, even if it is on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984379973', 'num_games_owned': 1922, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1402952232}
review:
Reminds me of old early 90s DOS platformers.  Obviously it looks a bit nicer and has a nicer resolution, but the core is basically the same.  This is a good thing to me. :)   Furthermore, the dev is implementing changes based on feedback from the community.

Thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972176174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1399753744}
review:
This is a very well done retro platformer.... everything runs very smooth, with good responsive controls. Great with an XBox pad. The difficulty ramps up as you progress, and you have to begin to learn the levels so you can collect all the items within the time limit.
Definitely has that one more go factor... I will beat the 17th level if it kills me.

And the music is the catchiest thing ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970986642', 'num_games_owned': 2575, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1802, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1628960875}
review:
Canyon Capers is a great little game.

Don't be fooled by the cute graphics, as this has some really good hardcore gaming, even with the super simple controls. You'll breeze through the early levels, and then it starts getting harder, or at least thats what I've found.

There's a good mix of achievements in here too... a few you'll get straight away, and some are way more skill based, that will take some time to earn.

I've given this a good couple of hours play now, and its really got that 'one more go' thing, as the difficulty ramps up, and im going to be giving it a good few more at least. I'm finding i'm learning the levels, and pathing some fastest routes around them. It takes me back to when we used to make maps of levels as kids.   I want 3 stars on every map.

I really hope the developers keep doing updates. There's a lot of promise in this one. Its great that indie's make games like this.

Its probably not for everybody, but if you like platformers... you'll love this one.

Still playing now and again after 5 years of it being out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004885007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1398627924}
review:
Canyon Capers hearkens back to a time when platformers based on item collection were as common as puzzle platformers are today. That makes it difficult for me to recommend, because almost every time I try playing one of those old platformers again, I quickly lose interest. It's not that I'm against item collection by default. It's just that the act of collecting items needs to remain fun and varied throughout the game in order for me to enjoy it. In my opinion, very few item collection games successfully accomplish that. They usually become bogged down in tedium and make me feel like I'm just going through the motions.

The goal of each level is to collect whatever the game tells you to, such as gems, coins, treasure chests, or food. Doing so will unlock an exit portal, which you then have to find and enter before time runs out. Along the way you'll have to dodge enemies and various environmental hazards. The levels are usually open-ended and you can choose which area to clear first. As you finish levels, you can also unlock different characters with special abilites, such as magnetically attracting certain items, or having immunity to certain hazards.

The main problem I have is that it just feels like a chore to get anything done. Your jump height is low, so there are plenty of spots where you have to jump up multiple platforms stacked on top of each other, which feels awfully monotonous. Your movement speed is slow, so if you have to backtrack through an area you've already cleared, or loop around, it can take a while. Collecting items usually doesn't involve any creativity on your part; mostly you're just jumping from platform to platform a lot. Level mechanics don't evolve that much either, from what I've seen (about half of the game as of this writing). The game adds things like moving platforms and springs, but I never felt like there was enough to make individual levels stand out from each other. Level distinction is something I value very highly in platformers, and I don't see enough here, personally.

Also, this game can't decide whether it wants to be easy or hard. You can get hit multiple times by enemies before running out of health, and once you do, the game just respawns you somewhere nearby. In addition, you're invincible for a couple of seconds every time you're hit. So, there's little incentive to pay any attention to danger. On the other hand, each level has a fairly strict time limit, and if you run out of time, you have to start over from the beginning. On top of that, both health and time factor into your rating upon finishing a level, and if you get too many low ratings, you won't unlock the next world. What does this game want me to do? If I carefully dodge obstacles, I could run out of time; if I rush through everything, I could get hit plenty of times and get a low health rating. What usually ends up happening, especially in later levels, is that I have to replay stages to get higher ratings. That's a lot of item collecting- much more than I have the patience for.

Finally, I don't like the menu interface. You can't use the mouse. The main menu constantly gets swapped with a high score table even while you're navigating it. There are buttons with pictures instead of text, and it's not obvious what all of them do at first.

If you loved the original game this one is based on, or if you're more fond of item collection games than I am, you might enjoy this. For everyone else, I can't recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034584728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1398471550}

author: {'steamid': '76561198039748421', 'num_games_owned': 517, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1662317208}
review:
I've been playing Canyon Capers for near enough the last 2 Hours, and its really fun and easy to get used to. The controls are great, and support for controllers 'just works' fantastic. It was just as much fun and easy to play with keyboard.  There is a nice learning curve from the easy to hard levels, its very fun and I love the retro look. Will be playing this one a lot, and can not wait to play more. I want the Afro character in the trailer... he looks mint.

I recommend everyone buys this game reminds me of crash bandicoot, mario and even super meat boy. Very happy with my purchase.
